Patient:
Can laryngoscopy detect laryngeal cancer?
Doctor:
Laryngeal cancer is a very common malignant tumor that can lead to death in severe cases. Common causes include: 1. Long-term bad habits: long-term smoking and alcoholism. Laryngeal cancer is a very important organ of the respiratory tract. Long-term smoking and alcoholism will cause great damage to the throat, and it is easy to form supraglottic laryngeal cancer. 2. Impact of the surrounding environment: The incidence of laryngeal cancer is also high due to professional relationships or long-term stay in air that is heavily polluted or contains chemical substances. 3. Exposure to radioactive light can cause changes in the body and cause malignant tumors. 4. It is caused by the lack of trace elements in the human body and the instability of sex hormones. The symptoms are: 1. When the disease occurs, the person's vocal cords are affected, resulting in hoarseness, unclear speech, and difficulty in vocalization. Intractable hoarseness is the most important early manifestation of laryngeal cancer. 2. Cough, blood in the cough, or blood in the sputum. 3. There is difficulty breathing. This symptom appears relatively late, and this symptom usually appears in the late stage. 4. There is a feeling of foreign body or obstruction in the throat, difficulty in swallowing, and pain when swallowing. 5. Throat pain, long-term swelling and pain in the throat, affecting the patient's rest and eating. 6. Metastasis to the neck is easy, especially supraglottic laryngeal cancer, which is prone to cervical lymph node metastasis. The first symptom of some patients is a neck mass. Laryngoscopes are very helpful in detecting laryngeal cancer, especially electronic laryngoscopes, which can detect laryngeal cancer. Therefore, if you find that you have symptoms similar to laryngeal cancer, it is best to get an electronic laryngoscope. Laryngeal cancer is a very common disease in our daily life, with a high mortality rate. If laryngeal cancer occurs, you can go to the hospital for further examination to see what is the specific cause, such as laryngoscopy. Examination, of course, laryngoscopy can only make a preliminary judgment. If you want to know whether the patient has laryngeal cancer, you need to conduct further examinations, and then conduct detailed special examinations about cancer. After all, cancer is not an ordinary disease. Be careful during the examination to avoid misdiagnosis and delay the patient's health.

Patient:
What to do if pregnant women have viral enteritis
Doctor:
Gastroenteritis and related illnesses have always been a problem for many pregnant women. So, what are the causes of gastroenteritis in pregnant women? How should pregnant women deal with gastroenteritis? 1. What is gastroenteritis in pregnant women? Gastroenteritis in pregnant women refers to symptoms of inflammation of the digestive system in expectant mothers. Generally divided into acute gastroenteritis and chronic gastroenteritis. Among them, acute gastroenteritis is divided into two types, namely simple and erosive. In simple terms, pregnant women will show symptoms such as anorexia and vomiting. In terms of the latter, erosive acute gastroenteritis, mainly gastrointestinal bleeding, and subsequent symptoms of melena and hematemesis. In fact, improper diet, viral and bacterial infections, etc. can all cause this disease. 2. How to deal with gastroenteritis in pregnant women 1. In the early stage of fasting, you can try to fast for one or two meals to reduce the burden on the gastrointestinal tract and take this opportunity to expel debris from the body through diarrhea. At this time, most vomiting symptoms will be effectively relieved. However, some expectant mothers may still experience nausea for a period of time. 2. Eat a small amount. After fasting, you should eat a small amount of porridge, white toast and other foods to avoid syncope caused by hypoglycemia. 3. Replenish water. If pregnant women have severe diarrhea and cause a large loss of water and electrolytes, the patient should drink an appropriate amount of sports drinks when feeling dizzy. However, for safety reasons, please consult a doctor in advance. 4. Do not give intravenous drips at will. If severe acute gastroenteritis occurs, you should take medicine under the supervision of a doctor. If you have watery stools with blood and symptoms of high fever, it may be infectious enteritis. It is best for pregnant women not to take intravenous drips. Taking medication without permission. It is only recommended to get an intravenous drip if a pregnant woman has cholera or is confused, and other situations should be avoided as much as possible. 5. Do not take antibiotics. Oral antibiotics are only recommended in rare cases where patients have severe infectious gastroenteritis or diarrhea while traveling. In fact, even bacterial infections in acute gastroenteritis do not require the use of such drugs because the body will heal on its own.

If there is inflammation, the infection must be controlled first; in the case of bleeding, hemostasis should be the main method and the inflammation should be controlled before surgery.

Patient:
Why is the nose easily red, swollen and painful?
Doctor:
The red, swollen and painful nose is most likely caused by rosacea. You should go to the hospital immediately for examination. After diagnosis, you should take medication under the guidance of a doctor. Rosacea, also known as rosacea, is a very common skin disease that mainly occurs in the nose. In addition to symptoms of red, swollen and painful noses, patients may also experience itchy skin, pustules, and nasal congestion. Symptoms such as enlargement and deformation appear. Patients should also pay more attention to good care during medication treatment: 1. The main causes of rosacea are many and complex. In addition to being related to hair follicle inflammation in the local skin, it is also related to endocrine disorders and unhealthy conditions in the patient's body. Eating habits, excessive smoking and drinking, external environmental stimulation and not paying attention to personal skin hygiene have a lot to do with it. 2. Patients with rosacea are mainly treated with anti-inflammatory, anti-bacterial and anti-infective drugs. During the use of drugs, they should consult a doctor and go to a regular hospital for examination and treatment. The therapeutic effect of drugs on rosacea is particularly obvious. . 3. Patients with rosacea who have red, swollen and painful noses should also pay more attention to daily skin hygiene during treatment. Use warm water to wash their face, do not use irritating skin care products, and do not scratch the affected area with their hands. Adjust their personal hygiene. The daily routine and work and rest time can help the disease heal faster. Patients should also pay attention to their personal dietary health during treatment. They should drink more water and eat more fresh fruits and vegetables. They should not eat too many spicy and irritating foods, nor should they eat fried, greasy and irritating foods. They should not smoke or drink. Maintain a light eating habit. For patients with red noses, they should pay attention to avoid cold exposure of the nose in daily life, and avoid sun exposure. Do not use hands or other tools or peel-off masks to treat blackheads on the nose. Eat less sweets and avoid excessive exercise. Etc., these can help relieve or eliminate the symptoms of red nose.

Patient:
Does prostatitis affect sexual function? Hello doctor! I have been diagnosed with chronic prostatitis recently, and I am very distressed. My wife is worried that it will interfere with sexual function. Hello doctor, does prostatitis interfere with sexual function?
Doctor:
Prostatitis patients generally do not interfere with sexual function. Penile erection depends on normal anatomy, nerve conduction and irradiation, and normal arterial infusion. The opening and flushing of cavernous sinusoids, the relative increase in venous inflow, and the regulatory effect of endocrine male hormones. It is generally recommended that men with diseases require treatment and conditioning. Prolonged inflammation can lead to problems with male fertility and premature ejaculation.

Patient:
How should I treat ovarian cysts? Hello, I went to the hospital to get an ovarian cyst. I would like to consult about this disease. How should I treat ovarian cysts?
Doctor:
Ovarian cysts can be physiological (that is, they disappear naturally with changes in the menstrual cycle) or pathological (cysts formed due to disease). Physiological cysts do not require surgery, while pathological cysts often require surgery. Surgery is performed to confirm the diagnosis and provide additional resolution. For women of childbearing age, after discovering an ovarian cyst, the next step to solve depends on the nature of the cyst. B-ultrasound results are very helpful for confirming the diagnosis. If the magnetic resonance imaging shows that the cyst is an echoless cyst and has not been divided, then you can observe it carefully for 3 months and repeat the magnetic resonance examination after 3 months. If the cyst is still there, surgery should be considered. solve.

Patient:
Which department should you go to the hospital for genital herpes?
Doctor:
Genital herpes is a sexually transmitted disease caused by the herpes simplex virus (HSV), mainly HSV-2 type and a few HSV-1 types. It is one of the common sexually transmitted diseases. Genital herpes can recur, which has a great impact on the patient's health and psychology; it can also infect newborns through the placenta and birth canal, leading to congenital infection of newborns. Therefore, this disease is also one of the more serious public health problems, and attention should be paid to its effective prevention and treatment. HSV-2 is the main causative agent of genital herpes (90%) and causes primary genital herpes after infection. After the initial outbreak of genital herpes subsides, the remaining virus transfers to the sacral ganglia through peripheral nerves along the nerve axis and remains latent for a long time. When the body's resistance is reduced or certain triggering factors such as fever, cold, infection, menstruation, gastrointestinal dysfunction, Under the influence of trauma, the latent virus can be activated, and the virus can descend to the surface of the skin and mucous membranes, causing lesions and leading to recurrence. Human beings are the only host of the herpes virus. The virus cannot survive without the human body. It can be inactivated by ultraviolet rays, ether and general disinfectants. There are many ways to transmit genital herpes. It may be transmitted through contact with some organs. There are also some infections through pollution. Newborns can be infected through the birth canal. To prevent genital herpes, you should do the following: 1. In the acute stage of genital herpes, avoid scalding with hot water, friction, scratching and other stimulation to prevent blisters from rupture and erosion, and try to keep the area dry and scabbed. Anti-infective treatment should be given at the same time when secondary infection occurs. 2. Patients with active genital herpes are absolutely prohibited from having sexual relations with anyone. Condoms may be considered during the asymptomatic period when herpes subsides, but they cannot completely prevent the spread of the virus. 3. When someone at home suffers from genital herpes, the patient's underwear, sheets and utensils contaminated by the patient's secretions can be disinfected by boiling or soaking in disinfectant. During the active phase of herpes, it is forbidden to have sex to avoid being infected by the virus. In addition, when one spouse is sick, the other spouse should also go to the hospital for examination and treatment. 4. Promote showering, do not use basins, and do not sit directly on the chairs in public baths after bathing; try to use squat toilets in public toilets. If you have genital herpes, you can go to the hospital and see the Department of Dermatology, Urology or Dermatology and Venereology.

Patient:
What are the tumor indicators of lung cancer?
Doctor:
Tumor markers mainly check carcinoembryonic antigen, small cell lung cancer, neuron-specific enolase, squamous cell carcinoma antigen, and tissue peptide antigen. Tumor markers can only be used as a reference and not as a basis for diagnosis. Whether the space-occupying lesion is benign or malignant can only be determined by going to three regular public hospitals for pathological examination rather than tumor markers. Treatment can only be standardized after clarification. Bronchial arterial infusion chemotherapy overcomes the shortcomings of systemic intravenous chemotherapy to a certain extent and improves the therapeutic effect of lung cancer. Lung cancer is mainly supplied by bronchial arteries, and many lung metastases are also supplied by bronchial arteries. This is the theoretical basis for transbronchial artery infusion chemotherapy to treat lung cancer and lung metastases. Compared with systemic meridian chemotherapy, infusion of chemotherapy drugs through bronchial arteries allows the drugs to directly act on the tumor without being diluted by systemic blood and metabolized by the liver. The concentration of chemotherapy drugs in the tumor can reach dozens of times that of intravenous chemotherapy, so it is significantly improved. It improves the ability to kill tumor cells, improves the efficacy, and significantly reduces the total dose of chemotherapy drugs, reducing damage to normal tissues and organs, thus reducing nausea, vomiting, bone marrow suppression and other side effects, and medical costs are also reduced. Bronchial artery infusion chemotherapy is performed by puncturing the femoral artery at the root of the thigh, introducing a very thin catheter (about 2mm in diameter), and inserting it into the bronchial artery on the side of the disease under X-ray fluoroscopy. After the blood supply of the tumor is confirmed by angiography, chemotherapy drugs are infused. In some cases with abundant blood supply, embolization therapy can also be performed at the same time to reduce the blood supply and nutrition of the tumor, thereby controlling the growth of the tumor and even shrinking it significantly. Bronchial artery embolization improves the efficacy of infusion chemotherapy and is particularly effective in recurrent hemoptysis caused by lung cancer. This treatment is generally very safe. A particularly serious complication is spinal cord injury, which is often caused by high-concentration contrast agents, chemotherapy drugs or embolization particles entering the spinal cord supply arteries, causing spinal cord ischemia. Patients may experience numbness, weakness or urination in the limbs. Defecation disorders, in severe cases, can lead to paraplegia, and most of them can be avoided with careful operation.

Patient:
What are the symptoms of hypercalcemic nephropathy?
Doctor:
Early manifestations include polyuria, nocturia, polydipsia, decreased urine specific gravity and osmotic pressure, and even nephrogenic diabetes insipidus, for which antidiuretic hormone treatment is ineffective. Elderly patients may develop aminoaciduria, renal glycosuria, proteinuria, nephrocalcification, urinary tract stones, and are often complicated by pyelonephritis. GFR decline, azotemia and uremia occur in the late stage. Systemic manifestations include dehydration, hypokalemia, hyponatremia, hypomagnesemia, renal tubular acidosis and other symptoms, skin itching, chronic conjunctivitis, and corneal calcification rings (band keratopathy) are special symptoms of hypercalcemia. physical signs. It may be complicated by tongue muscle atrophy, hyposmia, hoarseness, dysphagia, and ataxia. Hypercalcemia can stimulate gastric gland secretion and cause ulcer disease, which can cause gastric bleeding and perforation. If this disease is caused by increased secretion of parathyroid hormone, it may be accompanied by multiple stones, peptic ulcers, pancreatitis, etc. When the blood calcium concentration rapidly increases above 3.7mmol/L, a hypercalcemic crisis may occur, with a mortality rate of 60%. The patient has severe polyuria, dehydration, sharp increase in blood pressure, sharp deterioration of kidney function, headache, nausea, vomiting, abdominal cramps, convulsions, lethargy, delirium, stupor, coma, ventricular tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation. Laboratory tests can reveal hypercalcemia, hypophosphatemia, hyperchloremia, increased BUN and serum creatinine, and decreased creatinine clearance. Increased urinary calcium (hypercalciuria), higher than 0.1mmol/(kg.24h), higher than 7.49mmol/24h for men and higher than 6.24mmol/24h for women. Proteinuria is mostly mild, mainly low molecular weight proteinuria, and sometimes red blood cells, white blood cells, cell casts, and occasionally calcium casts can be seen. Imaging tests may reveal kidney stones or renal calcification. According to clinical manifestations and laboratory examination findings, such as increased blood calcium concentration, increased urinary calcium (hypercalciuria), red blood cells, white blood cells, cell casts, and occasionally calcium casts can sometimes be seen in the urine, as well as clinical features of renal function impairment. Urine, nocturia, aminoaciduria, renal glycosuria, proteinuria, nephrocalcification, urinary tract stones, often combined with pyelonephritis. GFR decline, azotemia, and uremia may occur in the late stage; or there may be special systemic signs, namely chronic conjunctivitis, and corneal calcification rings, namely band keratopathy; there may also be tongue muscle atrophy, hyposmia, hoarseness, Dysphagia, ataxia, gastric bleeding, and perforation. A rapid increase in blood calcium concentration leads to a hypercalcemic crisis. The patient exhibits severe polyuria, dehydration, sharp increase in blood pressure, sharp deterioration of renal function, and symptoms of headache, nausea, vomiting, abdominal cramps, convulsions, and drowsiness. , delirium, stupor, coma, ventricular tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation; the disease can generally be diagnosed at this time. In patients with renal failure, diagnosis may be difficult because blood calcium has decreased.

Patient:
What are the early symptoms of paronychia?
Doctor:
Paronychia is obvious and easy to diagnose clinically. It is mainly caused by Staphylococcus aureus. In the early stage, there will be redness, swelling and pain in the paronychia, which will continue to spread in a short period of time, forming periungualitis, which will cause severe pain and yellow-white pus. Liquid, if not treated in time, will develop into dactylitis and even cause osteomyelitis of the fingers. The main cause of paronychia is inflammation caused by bacterial invasion of the skin tissue near the paronychia due to skin injuries such as scratches and punctures. The main pathogenic bacteria is Staphylococcus aureus, which will cause severe pain and redness and swelling. Yellow and white pus liquid. Treatment is not difficult, but it brings great inconvenience to people's lives and walking. Paronychia is a disease that is very common in our country at present. Paronychia is caused by many reasons. Some people do not pay attention to hygiene and do not wash their feet regularly, which causes bacterial infection between the toenails and the seams. Therefore, If the nail groove becomes inflamed and abscesses may appear, don't worry at this time. Go to the hospital as soon as possible. Don't blindly take medication. It will aggravate your condition. You must use the medication as directed by the doctor. In severe cases, the nails must be removed. In acute cases, When the time comes, it will be too late to turn into chronic paronychia. 1. Paronychia is an early symptom of the disease. At the beginning, one side of the nail groove will be red, swollen and painful. It can become suppurative and infected in a short period of time. It can spread to the nail root and the opposite side of the nail groove, forming periungual inflammation, which can also spread to A subungual abscess forms under the nail. At this time, the infection has already occurred. If the infection becomes infected, pus will appear, white secretions will appear, and pain will occur. At this time, you should go to the hospital as soon as possible. 2. For the treatment of paronychia, hot compresses and external application can be used. In severe cases, the toenails should be removed. If pus has accumulated under the nail bed, the nails should be removed or the nails on the abscess cavity should be cut off. You should go to the hospital regularly for dressing changes and use some antibiotics as directed by your doctor. 3. For paronychia, you need to eat a reasonable diet, do not eat irritating food, do not eat greasy food, eat light food, eat more fresh fruits, supplement vitamins, eat more fresh vegetables, keep the stool smooth, and Drink plenty of boiled water, pay attention to hygiene and get enough rest. For paronychia, you need to pay attention to hygiene. You need to wash your feet every day, wear loose shoes, pay attention to hygiene, and clean the socks you change into. If you feel any discomfort, go to the hospital as soon as possible. Don't cut your toes too short. , pay attention to hygiene.

Patient:
What is the difference between artificial abortion and medical abortion?
Doctor:
Medical abortion, also known as medical abortion, refers to the oral use of drugs to terminate early pregnancy. In recent years, it has been widely used in clinical practice. In the early stages of pregnancy, no surgery is required, but injections or medication are used to achieve artificial abortion. The use of drugs to terminate pregnancy is a new development in the past 20 years. Currently commonly used drugs are used in combination. The former causes uterine decidua degeneration and necrosis and softens the cervix, while the latter excites the uterus and causes uterine contraction to promote the expulsion of the embryo. So, what is the difference between artificial abortion and medical abortion? 1. Time difference: medical abortion time is strictly controlled within 49 days of menopause. Abortion can be done within 14 weeks of pregnancy. If it is beyond 14 weeks, induction of labor will be necessary. By the way, the best time is between 35-50 days after menopause, because at this time the uterus is not too big, the pregnancy tissue is not too much, the fetus is small, it is easy to aspirate, the operation time is short, and there is less bleeding. 2. Infections caused by medical abortion are different. Infection caused by medical abortion is usually caused by not paying attention to vulva hygiene, or by having sexual intercourse before fully recovering after medical abortion, which induces genital inflammation, vaginal bleeding, abdominal pain, smelly vaginal secretions, etc. . Infection caused by artificial abortion is manifested in damage to the endometrium and myometrium, which can easily lead to habitual miscarriage and premature birth in subsequent pregnancies. 3. The recovery time is different. Medical abortion takes longer, and vaginal bleeding will occur for a long time after taking the medicine. The recovery time for artificial abortion is relatively short, as long as you pay enough attention. What is the difference between artificial abortion and medical abortion? Through the above introduction, I believe everyone has an understanding of the difference between artificial abortion and medical abortion. The above content can help everyone in daily life. In addition to nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhea and other gastrointestinal reactions, bleeding may occur during the medication process. Long time and excessive bleeding are the main side effects of medical abortion. Medical treatment is ineffective, and uterine evacuation is required if necessary. Medical abortion must be performed in a medical institution with formal rescue conditions.

Patient:
What is progesterone?
Doctor:
Progesterone secretion. Progesterone belongs to a class of hormones called progestins, which are involved in the menstrual cycle, pregnancy, and embryonic processes in humans and other species. When the ovary ovulates in the middle of menstruation, the follicle that releases the egg forms a corpus luteum, which secretes progesterone. Progesterone causes the endometrium to enter the secretory phase, maintaining its thickness until menstruation. At this time, the corpus luteum shrinks, the concentration of progesterone in the blood drops sharply, and the endometrium peels off to form menstruation. Progesterone promotes the growth of glands in the uterine mucosa in the late menstrual period and thickens the endometrium to prepare for the implantation of a fertilized egg. If progesterone is low, menstruation will be delayed. In women who are not pregnant, progesterone is secreted in large amounts by the corpus luteum of the ovary only in the second half of each menstrual cycle. The brain, liver and adrenal glands also secrete it. During pregnancy, the placenta can also secrete a large amount of uterine. Progesterone may also be a key metabolic intermediate in the production of other endogenous steroids, including sex hormones and corticosteroids, and plays an important role as a neurosteroid in brain function.

Patient:
What does vasodilin mean? Main symptoms: headache, as if motion sickness. Time of onset: about 20 days. Laboratory test results:
Doctor:
Vasospasm: It refers to the pathophysiological changes of blood vessels. The blood in normal blood vessels flows. When the blood vessels are exposed to cold or external stimulation, changes in local vascular stimulating factors, etc., the blood vessels are controlled and regulated by nerves and body fluids. Blood vessels The wall stops moving and undergoes tetanic contraction or expansion; causing changes in blood fluid dynamics within the blood vessel.

Patient:
Please describe the diagnostic testing methods for secondary hypertension.
Doctor:
Increased 24-hour urine 17-hydroxy and 17-ketosteroids, positive dexamethasone suppression test and adrenocortical hormone stimulation test are helpful for diagnosis. Intracranial sella X-ray examination, adrenal CT scan and radioactive iodide cholesterol adrenal scan can be used to locate the lesion. Aortography can confirm the diagnosis of aortic coarctation. High-dose tomographic intravenous pyelography and radionuclide renogram are helpful in diagnosis, and renal arteriography can clearly diagnose renal artery stenosis. During the period of elevated blood pressure, catecholamines and their metabolite vanillyl mandelic acid (VMA) are measured in the blood or urine. If there is a significant increase, it indicates pheochromocytoma. Ultrasound, radionuclide, computerized tomography (CT), and magnetic resonance show the location of the tumor.

Treatment with decoction, fumigation and washing has a certain effect. Your situation may be caused by genital warts. Pay attention to local hygiene and prevent cross-infection.

Patient:
Is gonorrhea secretion contagious?
Doctor:
The main cause of gonorrhea is infection of the genitourinary system by Neisseria gonorrhoeae. Many causes of Neisseria gonorrhoeae infection are mainly caused by sexual transmission and unhealthy sexual life; contact with the source of infection and contact with gonorrhea patients Infections from trauma caused by using articles, clothes and towels stained with secretions, etc. Gonorrhea is mainly transmitted sexually and through sharing underwear and underwear. It is not contagious through diet. It is recommended to use standardized medication according to the condition under the guidance of a doctor, avoid spicy, greasy and fried foods, eat more fresh vegetables and fruits, live a regular life and feel comfortable, pay attention to local hygiene, drink appropriate amounts of water, and avoid triggering factors. The incubation period of gonorrhea in men and women is about 3-5 days. The symptoms of gonorrhea in the early stage are not very obvious. The symptoms in men mainly include itching, redness, swelling and eversion of the urethra, pain during urination, a small amount of viscous fluid secretion, and a large amount of purulent secretion in severe cases, and stinging during urination. Cannot excrete. Symptoms of women: urethra infection, urethritis, cervicitis, etc. occur one after another, among which cervicitis is the most common. Gonorrhea complications are accompanied by fever and general malaise. There may be chills before the fever, and are often accompanied by symptoms such as loss of appetite, nausea and vomiting. There are many things to pay attention to in the treatment of gonorrhea. Sexual intercourse is prohibited before it is cured. Pay attention to the hygiene of the vagina. Diagnose and treat gonorrhea as soon as possible. Make sure whether there are comorbidities and treat them symptomatically. Whether you are allergic to drugs. At the same time, you must also Check and treat with your sexual partner. Gonorrhea patients should pay special attention to their diet during treatment, and do not let bad habits aggravate the condition of gonorrhea. The diet of gonorrhea patients should be based on light food, clear away heat and detoxify, and avoid eating hot and spicy food. After the condition stabilizes, they should eat less and more meals, and eat more protein-rich food. Gonorrhea is one of the common infectious sexually transmitted diseases, and it is also a Class B infectious disease that the country needs to focus on prevention and control. How to prevent gonorrhea? Have safe sex, use condoms, and pay attention to vaginal hygiene. Carefully follow up the patient's sexual partner and conduct timely examination and treatment.

Patient:
What is ampulla cancer?
Doctor:
Ampullary cancer has almost no symptoms in the early stage. Once symptoms appear, they are usually in the late stage. The main symptoms in the late stage include nausea, vomiting, painless jaundice, and melena. A few cases manifest as acute pancreatitis. The late symptoms of ampullary cancer are mainly not jaundice and pain, but obvious jaundice, skin itching, ascites, weight loss, weakness, etc. Abdominal pain and discomfort: 40 to 70% of patients with pancreatic cancer have abdominal pain as the first symptom, and 30% of patients with ampullary cancer also have this phenomenon. The causes of abdominal pain include: strong contraction caused by obstruction of the bile and pancreatic duct outlet, and abdominal pain in the form of abdominal pain. Paroxysmal, located in the upper abdomen, such as biliary colic. Visceral neuralgia caused by increased pressure in the bile duct and pancreatic duct manifests as dull pain in the upper abdomen, which worsens 1 to 2 hours after a meal and relieves after a few hours. Low back pain caused by cancer infiltration and compression of the celiac plexus is severe and patients often sit up or lie down on their sides all night, which is mostly a late-stage symptom. Jaundice: Painless jaundice is the most prominent symptom of pancreatic head cancer, accounting for about 30%. Cancer of the uncinate process of the pancreas is far away from the ampulla, so only 15 to 20% of patients suffer from jaundice. Cancer of the pancreatic body and tail is in the late stage Sometimes, jaundice may also occur due to metastasis and compression of the common bile duct or portal lymph nodes. Jaundice is persistent and progressive. Almost all patients with ampullary cancer have jaundice. In some patients, jaundice can fluctuate significantly due to ulceration and shedding of the cancer. Weight loss: fatigue due to reduced food intake, indigestion and cancerous consumption. Gastrointestinal symptoms: Most patients have symptoms such as loss of appetite, aversion to greasy food, nausea, vomiting, and indigestion. 10% of patients with ampulla cancer have a history of gastrointestinal bleeding and tarry stools due to cancer ulceration. Fever: It is rare for pancreatic cancer to be accompanied by fever, but patients with ampullary cancer often have a history of fever and chills, which is caused by secondary infection of the biliary tract. Signs: often accompanied by hepatomegaly. According to Courvoisier's law, painless jaundice if accompanied by gallbladder enlargement is a characteristic of pancreatic head cancer. It has reference value in distinguishing from cholelithiasis, but it is not necessarily reliable because gallstones The disease is often accompanied by secondary infection.

Patient:
What are the causes of external hemorrhoids in girls?
Doctor:
Hemorrhoids are a common disease in our daily lives. Generally speaking, the older you are, the more people suffer from hemorrhoids. But in today's society, the age of suffering from hemorrhoids is getting younger and younger. This is mainly caused by sitting for too long and not going out for activities and bad living habits. Some girls in their twenties have also begun to suffer from hemorrhoids. So girls What are the causes of hemorrhoids? What causes hemorrhoids in girls? 1. If girls have hemorrhoids, there are many reasons. For example, it may be dietary problems. In terms of diet, try to be light, and you must eat some whole grains. The diet must be reasonable, and the nutrition must be balanced. Try not to eat spicy food, and do not drink alcohol. 2. It may be caused by bad bowel habits. In normal times, you must develop better defecation habits, you must defecate regularly, and you must concentrate on defecation and do other things. 3. It may also be caused by endocrine disorders. In this regard, you need to pay more attention to the issue of rest. You must develop good work and rest habits, you must not stay up late, and you must ensure adequate and good sleep. 4. Some chronic diseases may also cause hemorrhoids. If the situation is serious, you must go to a regular hospital for relevant treatment. How to treat hemorrhoids? Generally, hemorrhoids do not require treatment when they are asymptomatic. When hemorrhoids present symptoms such as pain, blood in the stool, swelling in the anus, itching, etc., you must seek treatment, otherwise the condition will worsen. If the hemorrhoids appear in the following conditions, it means that the hemorrhoids are serious, and it is recommended that hemorrhoids surgery be performed: 1. External hemorrhoids are large and often inflamed with swelling and pain. 2. Internal hemorrhoids protrude from the anus every time you defecate, especially those that need to be retracted by hand. 3. Internal hemorrhoids bleed and the bleeding cannot be stopped by oral medications or injections. 4. Hemorrhoids often cause swelling, pain, erosion, and exudation, which affects life and work. For girls, hemorrhoids are something that is difficult to talk about. It seems that it is something very shameful, so many girls will not go to the doctor because they hide the disease. In fact, getting sick is something that happens to everyone, and treating the disease is something that every patient should actively do, regardless of the disease. Therefore, if girls get hemorrhoids, they must actively go to the hospital for treatment!

Patient:
Why does leucorrhea smell so much after pregnancy?
Doctor:
Normal leucorrhea should be milky white or colorless and transparent, with a slight fishy smell or tasteless; its secretion quantity and texture are affected by the levels of estrogen and progesterone in the body. It may be more or less, thin or thick with the menstrual cycle. cyclical changes. Normal leucorrhea is beneficial to women's health because it can play a self-purifying role. However, when the amount of leucorrhea is excessive, smells bad, changes color, or appears purulent, it may be that the body is sending an alarm, indicating the occurrence of certain gynecological diseases. Endocrine changes during pregnancy, progesterone increases, and it is easy to increase secretions. Failure to pay attention to hygiene and cleanliness can cause vaginal inflammation, resulting in yellowish leucorrhea with a peculiar smell. You can use topical medications. Usually, the underwear should be loose and breathable, not too tight, and the vagina should be washed frequently. The common leucorrhea after menstruation in women is mostly caused by other disease factors, such as: 1. The leucorrhea after menstruation has a fishy smell: some anaerobic bacterial infections, trichomoniasis infections or vaginitis caused by Haemophilus vaginalis infection. Leucorrhea often has a fishy smell. Treatment of abnormal leucorrhea caused by trichomonas vaginitis is with medication. After the first course of treatment is completed, you can go to the hospital to check the trichomoniasis situation. If it is not completely killed, use another course of treatment to make sure the trichomoniasis is eliminated, otherwise you need to prevent repeated infections in the future. 2. Leucorrhea after menstruation often has a foul smell: Leucorrhea has a foul odor. Leucorrhea disease caused by inflammation is difficult to cure in the short term. Patients with cervical erosion have a longer recovery period. Only by curing the cervical lesions can the problem of leucorrhea be solved. 3. How to treat leucorrhea with a fishy smell after menstruation: Some vaginitis is caused by Haemophilus vaginalis, and the leucorrhea has a special fishy smell. At the same time, there are also symptoms such as vaginal burning, pain, itching, and vulvar moisture. It is recommended to go to a regular gynecological hospital for diagnosis and treatment. There are two types of leucorrhea odor: 1. Fishy odor: vaginitis caused by some anaerobic bacterial infection, trichomonal infection or vaginal Haemophilus infection. In this case, leucorrhea is often accompanied by fishy odor. 2. Foul smell: If the leucorrhea has a foul odor, it is often caused by severe infections or tumors in the reproductive tract. Such as malignant tumors of the reproductive tract, severe endometritis, and severe cervical erosion. Especially in elderly women, if leucorrhea has a foul smell and is bright red in color, it is often a sign of malignant tumors.

Patient:
Causes of superior mesenteric artery embolism, how do you get superior mesenteric artery embolism?
Doctor:
Postoperative monitoring and treatment of patients with acute intestinal embolism are very important. Abnormalities in urine output, central venous pressure, pulmonary artery wedge pressure, arterial blood gas analysis, water, electrolytes, etc. must be corrected in time to prevent the occurrence of heart failure. Appropriate antibiotics must be used before and after surgery to prevent and treat infection. If an arterial catheter is already placed, anticoagulants and vasodilators can be continued to be administered through the catheter, and angiography can be performed after 24 hours to observe whether the blood vessels are unobstructed.

Patient:
Why does a baby cry in the morning? A 2-month-old baby rarely cries. He just keeps crying when he wakes up in the morning. He will cry again after being held for a while. There is no crying, no vomiting, no fever, and sometimes his hands and feet are wet. What's wrong with him? Why is the baby crying in the morning?
Doctor:
Crying is a baby's way of expression. Babies don't use words to express their needs. Crying is the baby's language. When the baby cannot communicate with the outside world using language, gestures, etc., crying is the only way for the baby to express his needs. According to the situation described, the child crying after waking up in the morning may be related to the child being exposed to severe sound and light stimulation, hunger, etc. It is also possible that the baby will cry when he has indigestion and bloating.

Patient:
Please describe the pathophysiology of hepatic echinococcosis
Doctor:
The hydatid cyst that enters the liver first develops into a small empty cyst, that is, an initial hydatid cyst, which does not contain the scolex; as the cyst gradually increases, a hydatid cyst, also known as an internal cyst, is formed. The internal cyst can be divided into two layers: inner and outer. The outer layer is a multi-layered horny cortex, which is elastic, like powdery skin, and white and translucent; the inner layer is the germinal layer, which is very thin and is actually the body of the hydatid. Can produce many scolex and germinal vesicles. After the germinal sac falls off, an ascus with the same structure as the mother sac is formed; the ascus can also produce a grandchild sac. Most of the scolex is attached to the cyst wall or deposited at the bottom of the cyst to form "hydatid cyst sand". During the growth process of hydatid cyst, due to the defense reaction of human tissue, a layer of fibrous capsule is formed around it, called the external cyst; its thickness is about 3-5mm, and calcification can occur. Hydatid cysts are mostly solitary, and about 1/4 are multiple. The cysts grow slowly, ranging from the size of grapes to the large ones with an intracystic volume of up to 20,000 ml. Hydatid cyst fluid is transparent and slightly alkaline, containing a large amount of scolex and ascus, as well as a small amount of inorganic salts and protein. A small amount of cyst fluid leaks out of the cyst wall and is absorbed by the human body, causing sensitization. If the cyst breaks through the human cavity, a large amount of cyst fluid is absorbed, which can cause allergic reactions or shock, or even death. In addition to degeneration and death due to lack of nutrition, the germinal layer, ascus and scolex in the cyst may also be broken due to rupture of the cyst wall. Bile fluid invades or merges with infection and loses its vitality, causing the cyst fluid and germinal layer to turn into yellow colloid, and even calcification occurs. Cysts can also develop secondary bacterial infections.

Patient:
What are the clinical manifestations of newborns?
Doctor:
High fever; neonatal vomiting; respiratory rate; crying; spitting; neonatal erythema; expiratory moaning; convulsions; appetite, sleep quality

What are the clinical manifestations of Pick's disease?
Doctor:

Patient:
What are the contraindications for loquat syrup for cough?
Doctor:
People with lung deficiency and chronic cough should not take it.

Patient:
Manifestations of anorexia in newborns
Doctor:
Symptoms of anorexia in children: Anorexia in children is also called digestive disorder. Anorexia in children refers to the main symptoms of long-term loss of appetite or lack of appetite in babies. Anorexia in children is not a disease, just a symptom. Babies with anorexia often experience vomiting, loss of appetite, diarrhea, constipation, bloating, abdominal pain, and blood in the stool. These symptoms not only reflect functional or organic diseases of the digestive tract, but also often appear in diseases of other systems, especially in central nervous system diseases or mental disorders and various infectious diseases. Therefore, it is necessary to inquire about the relevant medical history in detail, closely observe changes in the condition, and conduct correct diagnosis and treatment of the primary disease. In fact, most anorexia in children is not caused by disease, but by long-term bad eating habits, an unsatisfactory eating system, and a poor eating environment. Bad eating habits are the cause of the disease. For example, frequent consumption of high-protein and high-sugar concentrated diets, eating candies and other snacks before meals, irregular eating, irregular living, overheated climate, and high humidity will all cause anorexia symptoms in babies. Or it may be the baby's psychological factors that cause him to be unwilling to eat. So, how to improve the baby's anorexia through dietary therapy? Methods to deal with anorexia in children: 1. Eat regularly and quantitatively. Do not eat or eat less snacks, sweets, fatty and fried foods, and do not eat too full. If you want the child to be safe, leave enough room for hunger and cold. This makes sense. In addition, eat a certain amount of fruits and vegetables. Food should be diverse. Mothers may wish to learn more exquisite dishes to attract the baby's attention from the combination of ingredients and increase the baby's appetite. 2. Do not beat or scold the baby, or force the baby to eat a certain amount of food. Especially do not force the baby to eat high-end nutritional products. Try to relieve the baby's nervousness and let him eat easily and happily. Allow them to eat light foods so that their digestive system is not affected by emotions. If you find that your baby is in a bad mood, you should comfort him in time to avoid affecting your baby's appetite.

Patient:
What to do about acute urticaria
Doctor:
What should you do if you have acute urticaria? Urticaria is an allergic rash, commonly known as rubella, a skin disease. Also known as rubella block. Symptoms are the sudden appearance of many red bumps on the skin locally or all over the body, which are very itchy. At first glance, it leaves no trace, day after day, over and over again. Acute cases can be cured within ten days, while chronic cases often last for several months. The causative factors are complex. Some foods, medicines, insect bites, bacterial infections, exposure to irritating substances, cold and heat allergies, etc. may all cause this disease. Urticaria is mainly caused by allergic reactions and often occurs in childhood allergic diseases. They often develop hives after eating fish, shrimp, crab, eggs, beef and other allergic foods. Plant foods, such as strawberries, cocoa, tomatoes, garlic, etc., can also become allergens, and food additives such as condiments, pigments, preservatives, etc. can also cause allergies. For the treatment of urticaria, it is recommended to consult a professional doctor according to their specific instructions for treating urticaria. What can I eat for acute urticaria? When acute urticaria occurs, special attention should be paid to diet. Do not eat spicy and irritating foods, such as peppers, leeks, garlic moss, etc., do not eat fish, shrimp, crab and other seafood, and do not eat beef and mutton. Eat less fungi during the illness. Avoid contact with allergens, alcohol, strong tea, and irritating beverages. You can eat light, easy-to-digest foods, and eat more green, vitamin-rich fruits, vegetables and crude fiber foods. At the same time, we should also ask patients to pay attention to rest, ensure adequate sleep, avoid mental stress, anxiety, not to have too much stress, and most importantly, stay away from allergens. What should we pay attention to in acute urticaria? Avoid spicy fish: If there are no possible triggers, avoid fish, shrimp, crabs and spicy foods. Such as shrimps and crabs, fish, eels, pig head meat, rooster, beef and mutton, mushrooms, bamboo shoots, mushrooms, etc., because these foods are prone to produce wind, blood and heat, and can catalyze diseases. Capsicum, pepper, onion, curry, fennel, tobacco and wine etc. Because these foods can help heat and move the blood, inducing the occurrence of disease; sometimes it can directly become an allergen, causing allergic reactions.

Patient:
What to do if your hands shake, especially when using chopsticks. , when eating, it is difficult to use chopsticks. Hands tremble slightly. :
Doctor:
Hello, my hands are shaking, which is medically called tremor. It is only a symptom, which refers to involuntary rhythmic tremor of part or all of the body. Clinically, hand tremor is divided into: resting tremor, kinetic tremor, postural tremor, rebound tremor and vibratory tremor. wait.
Guidance: Clinical causes include Parkinson's syndrome, hepatolenticular degeneration, hepatic encephalopathy, cerebellum and brainstem lesions, cerebral arteriosclerosis, cerebral ischemia, drug poisoning, dementia, etc. Generally speaking, hand tremor symptoms appear more often in the elderly. Proper examinations should be done promptly to identify the cause and provide correct treatment.

What foods can you eat if your leucorrhea turns yellow and increases itching?
Doctor:

Plantain stewed pork belly, ingredients: fresh plantain, or dried plantain, pig belly, appropriate amount of salt. Method: Wash the purchased plantains with clean water, and do the same with the pork belly. After washing, put it into the pot, add salt and stew. It will be cooked in about half an hour, remove the residue and drink the soup. Efficacy: Plantain has the effect of clearing away heat and dampness, and treating leucorrhea. It is good for women. If women have excessive leucorrhea, they can drink some. 2. Sunflower syrup, ingredients: sunflower stems or roots, lotus leaves, appropriate amount of brown sugar. Method: Take sunflower stems or roots and lotus leaves, clean them, pour them into a pot, add water and boil them. When they are almost cooked, add brown sugar. Drink them twice a day before meals. Efficacy: Kuihe syrup has the effect of clearing away heat and resolving turbidity. Generally, yellow vaginal discharge in women is beneficial to disease treatment and helpful for body recovery. 3. Rock sugar and winter melon seed soup, ingredients: winter melon seeds, rock sugar. Method: Clean the winter melon seeds, grind them into powder with a hard object, pour them into a pot, add rock sugar, simmer over a slow fire, take it about twice a day, and take it continuously for a week. Efficacy: Rock sugar and winter melon seed soup has the effect of clearing away heat and promoting dampness. It is helpful in treating yellowish leucorrhea and is suitable for women suffering from leucorrhea caused by dampness and heat. To sum up, everyone knows that yellow leucorrhea is a sign of gynecological inflammation, so eat more fresh vegetables and fruits and lighter foods. If you have Qi and blood deficiency, you can eat some foods that can replenish Qi and blood, such as black rice, jujubes, red beans, and white fungus. Eat less cold food and avoid spicy food. If the leucorrhea turns yellow, you can take some medicinal food. Women pay more attention to their own health.

Patient:
Pharmacological effects of promolate
Doctor:
It is a non-addictive central antitussive drug. Its antitussive effect is weaker than that of codeine, and its equivalent antitussive dose is about 10 times that of codeine. This product can also relieve the spasm of tracheal smooth muscle caused by histamine, acetylcholine and barium chloride, and has a certain sedative effect. Obvious antitussive effect occurs 30-60 minutes after oral administration, and the effect lasts for 4-6 hours.

Patient:
Things to note when taking pansbolin
Doctor:
1. It may occasionally cause allergies. If necessary, a skin test can be performed with a concentration of 300g per ml. 2. Patients with renal insufficiency should reduce the dosage and use with caution. 3. SGOT and SGPT may temporarily increase during medication and may recover after discontinuation of medication. 4. It can cause blood picture changes. In severe cases, the drug should be stopped immediately. 5. This product can cause changes in intestinal flora, resulting in vitamin B and K deficiency, and may occasionally cause secondary infections. Common gastrointestinal reactions include nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhea, etc. 6. Combined use with aminoglycoside antibiotics is generally considered to have a synergistic effect, but may increase the damage to the kidneys. If placed in a dropper together, it may affect the potency of the drug. 7. Combined use with strong diuretics such as furosemide may cause kidney damage. 8. Large amounts of intravenous injection may cause vascular pain and thrombophlebitis. Be careful not to damage nerves when injecting intramuscularly. 9. This product should be applied immediately after dissolving, otherwise the color of the liquid will become darker.

Patient:
Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Severity Grading, Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Severity Grading Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Severity Grading
Doctor:
Condition analysis: Hello! Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease is a disease state characterized by airflow limitation that is not fully reversible. Guidance: The severity levels are: Level 0: high-risk state, characterized by chronic cough and sputum production, and still normal lung function; Level I: mild chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, characterized by mild airflow limitation. Chronic cough and expectoration are usually but not always present. At this stage, patients may not even notice abnormalities in their lung function. Grade II: Moderate COPD characterized by worsening airflow limitation and progression of symptoms of shortness of breath with activity. This is when patients usually begin to seek medical help because they have difficulty breathing or have an acute episode. Grade III: Severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, characterized by further worsening of airflow limitation, worsening of shortness of breath, and repeated acute attacks that affect the patient's quality of life. Grade IV: Very severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, characterized by severe airflow limitation or chronic respiratory failure. At this stage, quality of life is greatly affected, and acute attacks at this time can be life-threatening.

Patient:
Symptoms of early pregnancy termination
Doctor:
In the early stages of pregnancy, that is, the first three months of pregnancy, many women will have very obvious early pregnancy reactions due to increased hormone secretion, including drowsiness, sensitivity to cold, nausea, vomiting, breast problems, etc. However, if these reactions suddenly reduce or disappear during early pregnancy, We should also pay attention to it, because this may be caused by fetal arrest. So, what are the symptoms of early pregnancy termination? A fertilized egg must go through a complex and wonderful process before it can grow into a healthy baby. In the early stages of pregnancy, if the fertilized egg does not develop well, it is likely to stop growing and cause fetal arrest. Then, the symptoms of embryonic cessation of development are often not obvious, and some pregnant mothers are completely asymptomatic. The most obvious symptoms of fetal termination are abdominal pain and vaginal bleeding. In addition, some pregnancy reactions, such as morning sickness, breast tenderness, etc., suddenly stop, which may also be signs of fetal arrest. Symptoms of early pregnancy termination include: first, there will be no more early pregnancy reactions such as nausea and vomiting, and the feeling of breast swelling will also weaken. If the examination can find that the uterus no longer continues to increase, the pregnant woman will lose weight. Then there will be vaginal bleeding, often dark red bloody leucorrhea. Finally, lower abdominal pain may occur, and a check-up at the hospital may reveal that the fetal heartbeat has disappeared. In addition, it is important to know that most stillborn fetuses can be excreted on their own after fetal arrest, but if pregnant women have not expelled the fetus 3 weeks after the stillbirth, they will experience serious symptoms such as general fatigue, loss of appetite, abdominal drop, and heavy bleeding. Vaginal bleeding occurs when fetal termination occurs in early pregnancy. This is also an important symptom of fetal termination. It is mainly caused by the uterus expelling the fetus that has stopped growing from the uterus according to the natural elimination law. It manifests as vaginal bleeding. There is dark red blood flowing out of it. Experts say that most pregnant women can pass the stillborn fetus on their own after the fetal arrest, but some pregnant women have not passed the stillborn fetus 4 weeks after the fetal arrest. They may experience symptoms such as loss of appetite, abdominal drop, general fatigue, and heavy bleeding, which require attention. To sum up, there are many triggering factors for early fetal arrest, including endocrine deficiency, poor physical fitness, etc. Women who have experienced early fetal arrest in their previous pregnancy should pay more attention to it and take timely measures before and after pregnancy. Effective health measures. In order to restore the uterus to a healthy and normal state, it is important for female friends to find out the reasons for the miscarriage during this period, prescribe appropriate medicine to adjust the body, and pave the way for another pregnancy and a healthy baby.

The best thing is to combine chemical treatment with traditional Chinese medicine treatment. Traditional Chinese medicine treatment can reduce the patient's pain. Except for the implementation of radiation therapy. In daily life, patients should replenish their body with balanced nutrition, do more aerobic exercise to exercise, and maintain a happy mood, so as to strengthen their physique and speed up their recovery.

Patient:
What can be called sinus rhythm? Now my mother is a little older and her body has always been very healthy. However, recently she has been experiencing some headaches, chest tightness, and her blood pressure is also somewhat high. , and later went to the hospital for a routine physical examination, one of which showed sinus rhythm. What kind of help do you want: What is sinus rhythm?
Doctor:
Question speculation: The electrical guilt of normal people's heart fibrillation originates from the sinoatrial node of the heart. This heart rhythm that is caused by the sinus node of the heart is called sinus rhythm. If you have a normal heart rhythm, you don't need to worry. Pay attention to rest, ensure deep sleep, exercise more to strengthen your physical fitness, and drink more warm water. Eat a light, warm, low-fat, low-salt diet, avoid spicy, extremely cold, greasy foods and alcoholic products, and quit smoking. Sinus rhythm is a normal heart rhythm. Generally, the report sheet states that sinus rhythm is normal and does not require treatment. You just need to carefully observe and pay attention to your heart rhythm. If there are other symptoms, you should go to the hospital for careful examination and treatment in time.

Patient:
What is the diagnosis of orbital osteoma?
Doctor:
Pathological examination: Cross-section of the osteoma reveals a smooth, sometimes multilobed appearance. Microscopically, osteomas can be divided into 3 types (which may overlap): ivory, mature, and fibrous. Ivory osteoma is mainly composed of a small amount of fibrous connective tissue and irregular bone trabeculae; mature osteoma has thin trabeculae and more intratrabecular fibrous tissue. Fibrous osteoma has fibrous tissue and osteoblast activity. It is very similar to ossifying fibroma, but it does not show the local progressive development characteristics of the latter. 1. X-ray examination Osteomas commonly occur in the skull, facial bones and mandible, most commonly in the paranasal sinuses, and rarely in the orbital bones. Orbital osteomas can occur on the medial and lateral walls of the orbit, and occasionally in the orbital apex. Ethmoid sinus osteoma can protrude into the orbit and is difficult to distinguish from orbital wall osteoma. Frontal sinus osteoma may also protrude into the orbit, resembling an intraorbital superior wall osteoma. Dense osteoma appears as a semicircular or round-like dense shadow with high density, no trabecular bone structure, and smooth and sharp edges. The density of cancellous osteoma is like a plate barrier, and trabecular bone structure can be seen, or it may show ground glass-like changes, and spot-like dense shadows can be seen within it. Mixed osteomas are surrounded by cortical bone density and cancellous bone structure in the center. This density difference is difficult to distinguish from smaller osteomas. 2. CT scan Orbital osteoma is often discovered during CT scans due to other reasons. Thin-section scanning showed a network-like high-density mass in the orbital bone, and the density was higher than that of the orbital bone at the same level. In dense osteoma, it is difficult to distinguish cortical bone from trabecular bone. Cancellous osteoma rarely occurs alone and is surrounded by cortical bone and trabecular bone structure within. Osteomas are generally located within the bone. Larger osteomas can protrude beyond the bone contour, protrude into the orbit, and the eyeball can be displaced and protruded due to pressure, causing local soft tissue to bulge. 3. MRI The display of bone structure by MRI is often limited, and the display of osteomas is not as clear as CT. Osteoma appears as a low-signal focus on both T1 and T2-weighted images, with uniform or uneven signal, located within the orbital bone or protruding outward and connected to the orbital bone signal. The compression of the extraocular muscles and the movement of the eyeball by the osteoma in the sagittal and coronal views are clearer than those on CT.

That is, the foreskin scales will accumulate and stimulate the local mucosa to become inflamed again. Patient:
Is it a symptom of epilepsy to tremble often and have some convulsions? My uncle hit his child when he was teaching him a lesson. Later, the child often trembled and had convulsions. Is this a symptom of epilepsy? Can hitting the head cause epilepsy?
Doctor:
Common causes of fever and convulsions include high fever convulsions, epidemic meningitis, various purulent meningitis, tuberculous meningitis, Japanese encephalitis, other viral meningitis, toxic encephalopathy, neonatal tetanus, brain abscess, Epilepsy etc. Diseases causing afebrile or ineffective convulsions include intracranial hemorrhage, brain hypoplasia or malformation, severe cerebral hypoxia, infantile tetany, hypoglycemia, uremia, hepatic coma, infantile spasms, epilepsy, and brain tumors. , hypertensive encephalopathy, poisoning, etc.
Opinions and suggestions: The main symptoms of epilepsy are: convulsions, fainting, paleness, etc. Many people think that convulsions are epilepsy, so do convulsions mean epilepsy? Convulsions are one of the symptoms of epilepsy, but they are not unique among the symptoms of epilepsy. Other diseases can also cause convulsions, such as hysterical convulsions, hypocalcemic convulsions, febrile convulsions in children, hypoglycemic convulsions, etc., which are not included in the category of epilepsy. Therefore, convulsions are not always caused by epilepsy. Suggestion: When you have convulsions, go to the hospital for a check-up to find out what is causing the convulsions.

Inflammation in the mouth, cavities on the teeth, not rinsing after meals and before going to bed, and poor oral hygiene. Children's health care problems have always troubled parents. Patient:
What is galactosemia?
Doctor:
Galactosemia is an inherited metabolic disease in which patients cannot metabolize galactose normally, but they have enzymes that can break down lactose into galactose and glucose, so this symptom should not be confused with lactose intolerance. Galactosemia is a recessive inheritance, and the main cause of the disease is insufficient galactose-degrading enzyme. Goeppert first described the disease in 1917; in 1956, a team led by Hermann Krka identified galactosemia as a genetic defect in the enzyme galactose. The incidence of galactosemia is approximately 1 in 60,000 newborns. The incidence among Irish nomads is much higher, probably due to inbreeding, resulting in a smaller gene pool.

What are the causes of growth retardation?
Doctor:
Low breastfeeding rate; malnutrition; cigarettes; unbalanced diet; high temperature and cigarettes; incorrect addition of complementary foods (other foods); IGF1R gene haploinsufficiency; zinc deficiency; chromosomal abnormalities; deficiencies and imbalances; various nutrients Seriously insufficient intake; low breastfeeding rate from 0 to 6 months

Patient:
Which hospital in Chengdu is best for liver cysts? , a friend of mine has liver cyst. When he found out about this, he has been very unhappy. He always felt that it was a terminal illness. He looked listless every day. I felt so uncomfortable. Why can't I be stronger? I'm sad.
Doctor:
Hello! Liver cysts are benign lesions of the liver, and traditional treatments include surgical resection or percutaneous absolute alcohol injection. However, if a catheter is not left in place for larger liver cysts, there is a possibility of recurrence after alcohol is injected. The treatment method of percutaneous high-concentration acetic acid injection is simple. Under the guidance of B-ultrasound, liver cyst puncture is performed after local anesthesia, and the concentration of acetic acid is adjusted according to the amount of cyst fluid. Using this method to treat multiple cysts in the liver has a low recurrence rate, fewer injections, little impact on liver function, no obvious side effects, no pain for the patient, and is economical and safe.

Patient:
What is the disease of palpitations? Is it a type of heart disease?
Doctor:
Palpitations are an uncomfortable feeling of conscious heart beating. This condition is a symptom and does not necessarily mean that the patient has a heart disease. For example, people with autonomic nervous system dysfunction, or people with anxiety disorders or depression may also experience palpitations. But palpitations caused by this cause are not heart disease. If the patient has heart failure or coronary heart disease, angina pectoris induces arrhythmia and causes palpitations, this is a heart disease. Therefore, it is difficult to generalize whether palpitations are heart disease. It is necessary to find out the causes of heart palpitations, so that we can better judge whether palpitations are heart disease. Patients can undergo preliminary screening with cardiac color ultrasound, dynamic electrocardiogram, chest X-ray, and coronary angiography if necessary. Palpitations refer to a disease syndrome in which patients feel palpitations in their hearts, feel frightened and uneasy, and even become unable to control themselves. It is also called palpitation or panic, both of which are mainly based on the uneasiness in the heart. Those who are caused by panic and whose heart palpitations come and go are called palpitations. Those whose condition is milder and whose symptoms are not caused by panic but whose heart is vacillating and restless are called palpitations and whose condition is aggravated. The occurrence of palpitations is related to factors such as physical weakness, invasion of external evils, emotional factors or drug poisoning. Insufficient qi and blood, yin deficiency and excessive fire, phlegm and fire disturbing the heart, and blood stasis in the heart can all lead to palpitations. Patients must pay attention to taking secondary prevention medications on time on weekdays, and at the same time, they should combine reasonable lifestyle interventions. For example, they should pay attention to a low-salt and low-fat diet, and control the total salt intake to less than six grams per day. For the disease Patients in the stable phase should exercise 4 to 5 times a week, such as slow walking or Tai Chi. Patients whose condition is not serious can also be combined with jogging. Each exercise time should not be less than 30 minutes. Pay attention to regular work and rest, avoid staying up late due to fatigue, eat more fresh fruits and vegetables, and avoid smoked, fried, and pickled foods. Avoid eating spicy and irritating foods, and keep your diet mainly light.

But if it lasts for more than ten days, the effect is usually very poor or even no effect. It is best to take medication under the guidance of a doctor.

Doctor:

Fractures are more common in young adults and occasionally in the elderly. According to the different degrees of fracture, it can be divided into three types: humeral head fracture, humeral head fracture-dislocation, and humeral head comminuted fracture.

Patient:
Differential diagnosis of renal anemia in children
Doctor:
Differentiated from anemia caused by other causes, there are manifestations of kidney disease and other complications caused by renal failure, and laboratory test results are easy to identify. 1. Chronic blood loss anemia: The course of the disease is often slow and the anemia gradually worsens, affecting growth and development to varying degrees. The blood picture showed microcytic hypochromic anemia. Serum iron and bone marrow extraneous iron were reduced. 2. Chronic hemolytic anemia: onset is slow. In addition to common symptoms and signs of general anemia such as fatigue, paleness, shortness of breath, and dizziness, there may be varying degrees of jaundice. Spleen and liver enlargement are most common. Gallstones are a common complication, and obstructive jaundice can occur. Ulcers on the skin of the lower limbs and ankles are difficult to heal and are common in patients with sickle cell anemia. Tritrophic iron deficiency anemia: It is a hypochromic microcytic anemia caused by reduced hemoglobin synthesis due to lack of iron storage in the body. This kind of anemia occurs all over the world, with the highest incidence in infants and adolescents. It is one of the key pediatric diseases to be prevented and treated in my country. Aplastic anemia: except for acute radiation sickness, the disease generally has a slow course and progressive aggravation, often accompanied by bleeding tendency and Infections that are difficult to control. The hematological changes were normochromic anemia, pancytopenia, but the peripheral blood did not show bone marrow regeneration reaction, but reticulocytes decreased. Fat droplets in the bone marrow fluid increased, and all three lines of bone marrow cells were significantly reduced, with only an increase in the proportion of lymphocytes.

Patient:
Treatment and prevention of redness on palms and soles
Doctor:
Symptoms of redness on the palms and soles are common in chronic hepatitis and cirrhosis. Dietary conditioning for chronic hepatitis: Patients should eat more vegetables and fruits to supplement sufficient vitamins and fiber, and also help promote digestive function. Decreased liver function often affects fat metabolism, so many patients with chronic hepatitis have post-hepatitis fatty liver disease. Therefore, the diet should be low in fat, low in sugar (too much sugar enters the human body and is easily converted into fat), and high in protein. A high-protein diet should include plant and animal proteins, such as soy products, beef, chicken, fish, etc., and animal and plant proteins should be mixed in half. Ingested protein is broken down into amino acids after digestion to be absorbed, and then manufactured in the liver into protein, the most important muscle and blood component of humans. There are 8 kinds of amino acids that the human body cannot produce by itself and must be supplied from external sources. When animal and plant proteins are mixed and provided in a balanced manner every day, they can make up for their respective deficiencies and significantly increase protein utilization. An appropriate amount of plant protein can inhibit the amount of animal fat, reduce the impact on arteriosclerosis, and ensure the full absorption and utilization of essential amino acids. Picky eating is detrimental to recovery from liver disease. 1. Food intake should be appropriate. Digestive function is weakened in liver disease. Overeating often leads to indigestion and increases the burden on the liver. It is best to eat when you are 80% full. Overeating is bad for your liver and gastrointestinal function. 2. Eat a light diet, stir-fry dishes should be light, use less oil, eat less raw, cold, and spicy foods, and quit smoking and drinking. 3. Rational application of traditional Chinese medicine and tonics. Patients with hepatitis are not encouraged to take excessive tonics. A normal diet can provide sufficient nutrition. It is best to seek the advice of a traditional Chinese medicine doctor when taking tonics. Blindly taking tonics is not beneficial. The protein content in the diet of patients with decompensated cirrhosis should not be too high, because protein is easily broken down by bacteria in the intestines to produce ammonia, and ammonia is one of the important factors leading to hepatic coma. Patients recovering from acute hepatitis or severe hepatitis should eat a low-sugar diet, otherwise they are prone to fatty liver.

What are the symptoms of hand, foot and mouth disease? , doctor, my daughter is now three years old, and I am most afraid that she will get hand, foot and mouth disease. Hello, what are the symptoms of hand, foot and mouth disease?
Doctor:
Hand, foot and mouth disease is an acute upper respiratory tract infection caused by hand, foot and mouth virus. The initial symptoms of hand, foot and mouth disease include fever, oral mucosa, herpes, and red rashes on the hands and feet in severe cases. Red rashes can occur, including on the buttocks. Hand, foot and mouth disease mostly occurs in spring. If there is hand, foot and mouth disease that is prone to occur in kindergartens in spring, try to ask the children to rest at home and not go to kindergarten.

Patient:
Can you sit still for a long time with symptoms of tailbone fracture?
Doctor:
Tail fractures usually do not change much and you can sit, but not for too long. It also works fine, but be careful about adjusting the timing and intensity. Strengthen the regulation of blood and qi and blood, and improve blood circulation. Circulation and functional status. Pay attention to your diet, drink as much water as possible, and eat less spicy food, such as spicy food. After injury, persistent pain in the humerus should be carefully investigated. Obviously, band sensitivity is mainly caused by cracks, and the fracture can be determined along the direction of sensitivity. Conducted pain is milder than that of a lumbar spine fracture, especially when standing. When sitting in a chair, gravity acts directly on the appendix causing pain, so patients prefer to stand or sit on the side of their buttocks. Since the surface of the humerus is subcutaneously congested, deep injuries are easily exposed under the skin, so it is possible to detect skin abrasions, hematomas, subcutaneous congestion or contusions in cracks during physical examination. A digital anal examination can be performed based on sensitive areas, displacement of fractures, and the presence or absence of bleeding. If there is significant dislocation and if it is an open fracture, it is presumed that the fracture line is running. Fractures involving the pupillary can irritate the sacral nerve branches, causing abnormalities such as tenderness, tingling, numbness and loss of chair area. Humerus fracture fracture. Transverse fractures can be seen in different planes of the humerus, but are more common in the mid and lower segments. Longitudinal fissure fractures, which occur simultaneously with a pelvic fracture or the removal of one side of the ankle, are rare compared to transverse fractures, which are caused by intense violence. Typically, the fracture line occurs in the lateral pupil. In severe cases, one half of the pelvis and the same side of the lower limbs move upward, and bladder symptoms, rectal and retroperitoneal hematomas may occur. Comminuted fractures are mostly severe stellate fractures, caused by local opacity caused by local turbidity. Displacement is not obvious. It's easy to overlook the diagnosis if you don't pay attention to the tests. You should pay attention to radiographs and avulsion injuries. The sacrosacral ligament is easily lost at the junction of the lower part of the tibia due to avulsion and rupture.

Patient:
What is acute sinusitis?
Doctor:
Acute sinusitis is an acute inflammation of the sinus mucosa. Mostly secondary to acute rhinitis. Acute infectious diseases, tooth root infections, allergies, barotrauma, foreign bodies in the nasal cavity, tumors, adenoid hypertrophy, chronic diseases and poor body resistance can all cause it. The most common pathogenic bacteria are pyogenes, such as diplococci, streptococci, staphylococci, etc. Fungal infections are less common. The main symptoms are nasal congestion, runny nose, headache, and in severe cases, chills, fever, and general malaise. It is more common in the maxillary sinus and ethmoid sinus. X-ray examination is one of the means of diagnosis.
