Patient:
To what extent does pulmonary atrophy occur in closed pneumothorax? , Hello, what is the extent of pulmonary atrophy in closed pneumothorax? If I just sit back and watch him drag me along, will it get very serious?
Doctor:
If the lung decomposition margin of pneumothorax is less than 30%, it may be absorbed by itself, and no special treatment is needed. If the amount is large, closed chest drainage is required to expel the gas. Otherwise, the gas will control the lung tissue for a long time, which will lead to atelectasis. In addition, the sputum cannot be coughed up, which may lead to secondary infection. The longer this time process, the smaller the chance of waste, and finally constitute lung consolidation, which means that this The lung tissue in the area loses its normal function, which may affect normal breathing. And once this part of the prickly heat is infected again, it may form empyema.

Patient:
How long does it take to get results from hpv test
Doctor:
The HPV virus is one of the viruses that can easily cause cervical cancer in women. It mostly occurs in women over 30 years old, so it is necessary for women to undergo cervical TCT and HPV screening. The HPV virus is one of the viruses that can easily cause cervical cancer in women. It usually occurs in women over 30 years old, so women should pay attention to it. Because women are becoming more and more health-conscious, some women undergo cervical pre-cancer screening every year. First of all, TCT examinations are faster because they use imaging examinations. Any hospital that can perform TCT examinations can usually produce results on the same day. Some hospitals are even very fast and can produce TCT examinations in only 20 minutes. Check the results. However, the results of the HPV test are much slower, because this involves qualitative and quantitative testing of the HPV virus. If you only screen whether there is a positive result, the speed is relatively fast, and it can usually be obtained on the same day. However, when it comes to the qualitative and quantitative analysis of HPV viruses, that is, which type of virus is specifically infected and what type of virus it is, the speed is much slower. Secondly, it is best to go to a professional hospital for an HPV test, such as the local Centers for Disease Control and Prevention or a sexually transmitted disease specialist hospital. This type of hospital has relatively advanced diagnosis and treatment technology for HPV viruses, so both the examination speed and the treatment speed are relatively fast. If the test is done in a small hospital, or in a city with relatively backward medical technology in the third or fourth tiers, since it is not qualified to test for HPV, the sample needs to be sent to a nearby big city for analysis. It takes at least 7 days. Therefore, cervical examination TCT and HPV examination are also related to the region where the patient is located. The above is an introduction to "how long does it take to get the results of cervical examination TCT and HPV examination". As can be seen from the above introduction, TCT examinations generally do not take too long, and most results are available on the same day. However, HPV virus examination is much more professional, so the examination speed will be slower and may even take more than 7 days.

Patient:
Why do I have a headache every time before an epilepsy attack? I have been suffering from epilepsy for more than 2 years. Every time I have a headache before the attack, I feel like I have a headache every time I have a headache. My epilepsy has recurred and I would like some consultation. Why did I have a headache before the epilepsy relapsed?
Doctor:
Your disease has headache epilepsy. Headache epilepsy is generally believed to be related to the hypothalamus. The hypothalamus is the high-level unrestricted nerve center of the subcortex and is connected with various areas of the cerebral cortex, the reticular structure of the brainstem, and the unrestricted nerves of the spinal cord. The centers are all closely connected. After the hypothalamus is interfered by various harmful factors, abnormal pulse lesions can be formed, resulting in various symptoms of autonomic nervous system disorders. When abnormal pulses spread to the neurons of the intracranial pain-causing structures, headaches occur. In addition to regular treatment for epilepsy, patients also need to pay attention to diet, such as eating properly and staying in a happy mood. At the same time, patients should also pay attention to choosing a regular hospital for diagnosis, so as to obtain good treatment results.

Patient:
induction process
Doctor:
Induction of labor refers to the termination of pregnancy after 28 weeks of gestation when correct artificial methods are used to induce uterine contractions due to maternal or fetal reasons. It is generally divided into mid-trimester induced labor and late-trimester induced labor. Mid-trimester induced labor is a termination of pregnancy due to eugenics or family planning needs. Rivanol is often used to induce labor, and it is necessary to go to the hospital and have the surgery performed by a professional doctor. Because of improper handling, complications such as bleeding, infection, and fetal legacy may occur. Pre-induction examination 1. Ask for detailed medical history, including past history, bleeding history, liver and kidney disease history, menstrual history, pregnancy and childbirth history, and the course of this pregnancy. 2. General examination and gynecological examination, routine testing of leucorrhea. 3. Measure body temperature, pulse, blood pressure, blood test, urine routine, etc., and if necessary, measure liver and kidney function, chest X-ray, and electrocardiogram. 4. Severe cervicitis or excessive secretions need to be treated first, and can only be performed after the condition improves; antibiotics are given before surgery to prevent infection. If necessary, conduct secretion culture and drug sensitivity testing. 5. People with advanced pregnancy, cervical dysplasia, small cervix, and long cervical canal need to be given certain drugs before surgery. 6. If necessary, perform B-ultrasound to locate the placenta. Patients with low-lying placenta are contraindicated. Main adverse reactions and treatments of late induction of labor 1. Too strong uterine contractions, fetal distress, one contraction lasting more than 2 minutes (or 90 seconds) or the number of contractions in 10 minutes is >5 (i.e., the interval between contractions is less than 2 minutes) , with or without fetal heart rate changes (late decelerations and prolonged decelerations) are called hypercontractions. Excessive uterine contractions can cause uteroplacental hypoperfusion and fetal hypoxia, and may lead to the risk of uterine rupture, placental abruption and premature delivery. Once excessive uterine contractions occur, the patient should lie on the left side, inhale oxygen, and receive fluid infusion. Those who receive oxytocin drip should reduce the dosage of oxytocin or stop using it. Those who use PGE2 vaginal controlled release agent should immediately take out the drug and monitor changes in fetal heart rate. Condition. Due to the short half-lives of oxytocin and Cervidil, uterine contractions may weaken after discontinuation of the drugs. If necessary, magnesium sulfate or adrenergic receptor antagonists (such as hydroxyephedrine) can be given to suppress uterine contractions, and terbutaline can be injected intravenously or subcutaneously for intrauterine resuscitation. If uterine contractions are too strong and difficult to control, there is fetal risk. If there is cardiac abnormality and feces-stained amniotic fluid, and the delivery cannot be completed in a short period of time, a cesarean section must be performed immediately to end the delivery. 2. Uterine rupture often occurs in multiparous women, patients with scarred uterus, abnormal fetal position, multiple pregnancy and uterine hypertonia. It is necessary to strictly control the indications for induction of labor and actively prevent and treat excessive uterine contractions.

Patient:
How to treat pelvic effusion in women
Doctor:
Pelvic effusion is a manifestation rather than a disease. Rather, it is a description of the fluid in the pelvic cavity on imaging. It can be divided into two types: physiological pelvic effusion and pathological pelvic effusion. Pathological pelvic effusion can occur after pelvic inflammatory disease, adnexitis or endometriosis and is the main imaging feature of pelvic inflammatory disease. Physiological pelvic effusion causes a small amount of pelvic effusion during the menstrual period or ovulation period. Such as a small amount of menstrual blood reflux, follicular fluid accumulation during ovulation in the middle of menstruation, and constipation may lead to pelvic effusion. Causes of pathological pelvic effusion: (1) Failure to pay attention to hygiene during menstrual period. (2) Inflammation of adjacent organs spreads, and women are prone to pelvic effusion when suffering from appendicitis or peritoneal inflammation. (3) Postpartum and post-abortion infections. After childbirth and induced abortion, the body is weak and the immunity is low. Bacteria in the vagina and cervix can ascend and cause pelvic effusion. (4) Infection after gynecological surgery, artificial abortion surgery, ring insertion (removal) surgery, fallopian tube angiography (fluid drainage), etc. It will cause bacterial growth and lead to pelvic fluid accumulation. (5) Others, ovarian and fallopian tube tumors, liver and kidney diseases can cause pelvic effusion accompanied by ascites and even pleural effusion. Treatment methods for pelvic effusion: 1. General treatment to relieve mental concerns, enhance confidence in treatment, increase nutrition, exercise, pay attention to the balance between work and rest, and improve the body's resistance. 2. The benign stimulation of warm physical therapy can promote local blood circulation in the pelvis. Improve the nutritional status of tissues and increase metabolism to facilitate the absorption and resolution of inflammation. 3. Drug treatment uses anti-inflammatory drugs, hormone drugs or traditional Chinese medicine for symptomatic treatment. 4. Surgical treatment: Surgical treatment is possible for lumps, hydrosalpinx or fallopian tube ovarian cysts; laparoscopic surgical exploration is also recommended for those with small infection foci and repeated inflammation. Surgery is based on the principle of complete cure to avoid residual lesions. For young women, ovarian function should be preserved as much as possible.

Patient:
What are the recommended drugs for anemia caused by CTX?
Doctor:
Lycium barbarum decoction

Patient:
Treatment of Folliculitis of the Head
Doctor:
For the treatment of folliculitis, first of all, folliculitis is caused by staying up late, diet, physical constitution, low immunity, bacterial infection, etc. Keep the head clean, wash it regularly, disinfect the affected area with iodine, apply fusidic acid ointment, and take oral anti-inflammatory. Taking medicine to control inflammation, not eating spicy food, avoiding tobacco and alcohol, drinking more water, and eating more fresh vegetables and fruits, the symptoms were gradually controlled. The symptoms of scalp folliculitis are not symptoms of low immunity. The symptoms of scalp folliculitis are caused by a damp constitution and oily skin. Symptoms of folliculitis occur because the sebaceous glands of oily skin secrete too much oil and clog the hair follicles. If symptoms of folliculitis occur, drugs that inhibit oil secretion can be used. Scalp folliculitis is an inflammatory change caused by the invasion of pyogenic cocci around the mouth of hair follicles. Folliculitis starts as red and substantial papules, and then rapidly develops into papular abscesses. If it occurs on the head, it is called scalp folliculitis. Those that occur on the lower jaw are called "sheep's beard sores", "beard sores", and "bird's nest sores"; those that occur between the eyebrows are called "eyebrow sores"; those that occur on the buttocks are called "sitting sores", etc. Traditional Chinese medicine has different names based on the location and shape of the disease, such as large bead sores, hairline sores, beard sores, mole cricket boils, mole cricket boils, mole cricket head, etc. This disease tends to occur on the head, neck, buttocks, perianal area or other parts of the body, and has a tendency to recur. It often occurs in multiple places. It is stubborn in nature and difficult to cure. Comprehensively classify folliculitis, legislate according to the disease, formulate and administer prescriptions in accordance with the law; pay attention to diet and daily life, from clinical treatment to life conditioning. Folliculitis is an inflammation caused by the invasion of pyogenes around the hair follicle opening and limited to the upper part of the hair follicle. It is divided into two types: purulent and non-purulent. It is more common in people with low immunity or diabetic patients, and is more likely to occur on the head and neck. If it occurs on the head, it is called scalp folliculitis. Folliculitis begins as red, substantial papules, and then rapidly develops into papular abscesses, which then become dry and crusty, leaving no trace after the scabs fall off. The rashes are numerous but not integrated. Capsulitis is more common in adults, with conscious itching or mild pain and generally no systemic symptoms. The rash starts out as red follicular papules the size of a pinhead, and gradually turns into large miliary pustules with hairs running through the center and inflammatory redness around them. Pustules mostly appear in batches and do not merge with each other. After the pustule ruptures, a small amount of pus and blood is discharged and forms a yellow scab. The scab heals immediately without leaving any scars. Folliculitis can recur and form chronic folliculitis, which can cause permanent hair loss if it occurs on the scalp. It is recommended to go to the hospital for examination and diagnosis in time, actively cooperate with treatment, and maintain a good attitude.

Patient:
How should lymphoma be treated? Last month, I went to the hospital for a careful examination and found out that I had lymphoma. The whole person is not very good. I want to know how to treat lymphoma.
Doctor:
If the disease is like this, surgery is recommended as soon as possible. If conditions do not permit, radiation therapy, chemotherapy, or autoimmunotherapy are recommended. If this is the case, it is recommended to find and resolve it as soon as possible, otherwise this situation will happen again and again. This can branch off to other parts of the body. Patients with malignant lymphoma should take medications on time and understand chemotherapy according to the doctor's recommendations, and their white blood cells should be tested from time to time. During the treatment process, if lymphoma patients experience adverse drug reactions again, the doctor should be notified promptly and appropriate symptomatic measures should be taken. Lymphoma patients should live regularly to avoid fatigue and mental shock. It is suitable to eat foods with high protein, calorie and vitamin content, as well as fresh vegetables and fruits.

Patient:
Check what causes rectal cancer
Doctor:
What causes rectal cancer? Rectal cancer is a common disease, and most patients want to know the causes of rectal cancer to prevent the occurrence of rectal cancer. At present, the direct cause of rectal cancer is unknown, but it is generally believed to be related to chronic inflammation, rectal polyps, and heredity. In addition, foreign studies have found that rectal cancer is also related to diet, especially high-calorie, high-protein, and high-fat diets, which will increase the incidence of rectal cancer. Therefore, it is recommended to eat a light diet, eat more crude fiber foods and fresh vegetables, and avoid eating big fish and meat. At the same time, it is recommended to go to the hospital for a colonoscopy in time to understand whether there are rectal polyps, rectal inflammation and other diseases to prevent the occurrence of rectal cancer. Precautions for treating rectal cancer include: First of all, pay attention to dietary taboos, because colorectal cancer is also a disease closely related to living habits. Secondly, for patients, being able to use traditional Chinese medicine treatment compliance is critical. Then there are many legends in the world, and there are many wild doctors who use partial prescriptions, and partial prescriptions can also have a very good supplementary and therapeutic effect in some aspects. But most biased prescriptions are promoted for profit. Therefore, its effect is relatively limited, and its target group is relatively narrow. Therefore, we only use some folk remedies on the Internet as a reference. It is best to ask a doctor for judgment, and you must not completely trust them. If you completely rely on it, it may lead to mistakes and the development of diseases. Things to note about rectal cancer diet: Rectal cancer is a very common malignant tumor in the digestive system and a type of colorectal cancer. Generally, the diet for rectal cancer should be light and easy to digest. Avoid spicy and greasy food. Smoking and alcohol are taboo. A high-protein diet can be appropriately supplemented to help enhance the patient's resistance and assist in anti-tumor treatment. After rectal cancer is diagnosed, if there is no widespread metastasis elsewhere and surgical treatment is possible, radical surgery will be the main method. Postoperative treatment will require adjuvant radiotherapy, chemotherapy and other comprehensive treatments. During radiotherapy and chemotherapy, you should also pay attention to a lighter diet and avoid eating too greasy food, because chemotherapy and radiotherapy may cause gastrointestinal reactions, nausea, vomiting, etc. If you eat greasy food, it will aggravate the vomiting.

It can quickly solve the problem of premature ejaculation.

Patient:
What happens if you have a stillbirth early in pregnancy?
Doctor:
If we specifically analyze the symptoms of stillbirth in early pregnancy, they can be roughly expressed as the following situations: 1. The fetal movement stops and the breast swelling disappears. After examination, if it is found that the uterus no longer continues to increase, the weight drops, and the fetal heartbeat disappears, it is very serious. Most likely it was stillbirth. 2. Most stillbirths can be excreted on their own, but if pregnant women have not expelled the fetus 3 weeks after the stillbirth, they will have severe symptoms of stillbirth such as general fatigue, loss of appetite, abdominal drop, and massive bleeding. 3. B-ultrasound examination of stillbirth can indicate that the fetal movement and heartbeat have disappeared, and sometimes the fetal head has been deformed. Common clinical causes of stillbirth in early pregnancy include the following conditions: 1. Chromosomal abnormalities: Whether it is sperm or eggs, as long as the chromosomes carrying genetic material are abnormal, even if a fertilized egg is formed, the embryo will not develop normally. Therefore, if there is a genetic history in the family, medical diagnosis and pre-pregnancy physical examination should be carried out before pregnancy. 2. Smoking or alcohol abuse: Male smoking and alcohol abuse will affect the quality of sperm, while female smoking and alcohol abuse will not only affect reproductive capacity, but also cause fetal malformations, and in severe cases, stillbirth may occur. 3. Viral infection: Pregnant mothers are infected with viruses such as rubella, cytomegalovirus, measles virus, and hepatitis B virus in the early stages of pregnancy. These viruses may be fatal to the fetus. 4. Taking drugs that affect embryonic development: Many expectant mothers mistakenly take cold medicines and other drugs without knowing they are pregnant. The ingredients of these drugs may affect embryonic development and health. 5. Placental factors: placental abruption, placenta previa, etc., lead to insufficient oxygen supply to the placenta and cause the fetus to die from hypoxia. 6. Pregnant mothers have chronic diseases themselves: Pregnant mothers have serious chronic diseases, such as diabetes, hypertension, heart disease, viral hepatitis, etc. Long-term medication treatment will have an impact on the life and health of the fetus. 7. Exposure to radiation or electromagnetic radiation: Pregnant mothers were exposed to X-rays without knowing it, and received a large amount of radiation exposure. 8. Contact with toxic substances: Harmful substances include toxic chemicals, inferior decoration materials, etc. If a pregnant woman discovers abnormal phenomena after pregnancy, such as the above-related symptoms of stillbirth, she should immediately go to the hospital for examination and timely treatment.

Patient:
Are there any home remedies for asthma in children? My baby has asthma. He is four months old. He gets sick whenever he catches a cold. He takes a lot of medicine. He is also in pain and his family is also worried. Is there any folk remedy that can be used to treat it?
Doctor:
Hello, dietary therapy is possible. Since the diet itself can sometimes induce or aggravate asthma, children with asthma should be careful to avoid eating foods that are too salty, too sweet, or too spicy. In addition, children who are allergic to certain foods such as fish and shrimp should avoid eating them. Especially when children have a cold, do not let them eat fish, shrimp, crab and other aquatic products to avoid inducing or aggravating the condition. Anti-asthma porridge: 50 grams of soybeans, 10 grams of Polygonatum odorifera, 15 grams of yam, 20 grams of astragalus, 1 white pear, add appropriate amount of water, cook the soybeans, and leave 150 ml of remaining juice, 15 ml each time, 3 times a day. Used for those with insufficient lungs and spleen.

Patient:
My child has tonsillitis and a sore throat and cannot eat anything. My child is a boy, 7 years old. At first, his throat hurt even when he drank water. I noticed that his voice was a little hoarse when he spoke. At the same time, he had a slight fever and was not energetic. I would like to ask: What should children with tonsillitis and sore throat not eat?
Doctor:
If a child suffers from tonsillitis, the first thing to do is to keep a light diet, which can be mainly vegetables and fruits. Fruits and vegetables are rich in vitamins and trace elements, and are relatively light, so they are very helpful in the treatment of the disease. Fruits For children, it is recommended to choose pears, apples, etc. For vegetables, green vegetables, cabbage, tomatoes, etc. are all good. You can choose according to the child's preferences. For other diets, it is recommended to choose some that are more pulpy and easy to digest, such as boiled pasta and Porridge is good. In addition, you should also pay attention to drinking more boiled water, eating less beef, mutton, dog meat and other fat products. It is best to eat less or no seafood. In addition to cooperating with doctors, parents should also help with the treatment of tonsillitis. Children should develop good eating and living habits to help them recover as soon as possible.

Patient:
Differential diagnosis of hemoptysis accompanied by chest pain
Doctor:
The primary disease of hemoptysis must be identified based on the accompanying symptoms of hemoptysis: 1. Fever, which can be seen in tuberculosis, pneumonia, lung abscess, pulmonary hemorrhagic leptospirosis, epidemic hemorrhagic fever, bronchial cancer, etc. 2. Accompanied by chest pain, it can be seen in lobar pneumonia, pulmonary infarction, tuberculosis, bronchial cancer, etc. 3. Accompanied by choking and coughing, it can be seen in bronchial cancer, mycoplasma pneumonia, etc. 4. With skin and mucous membrane bleeding, attention must be paid to leptospirosis, epidemic hemorrhagic fever, blood diseases, connective tissue diseases, etc. 5. If accompanied by jaundice, attention should be paid to leptospirosis, lobar pneumonia, pulmonary infarction, etc. Clinical color identification of hemoptysis is helpful for the diagnosis of clinical diseases. Pink foamy sputum indicates acute left heart failure (also known as pulmonary edema); bronchiectasis hemoptysis is bright red; typical lobar pneumonia hemoptysis is rust-colored; pulmonary embolism Coughing thick dark red bloody sputum: When mitral stenosis is combined with pulmonary congestion, the hemoptysis is not bright red, but generally dark red. The color of hemoptysis is helpful for clinical disease diagnosis, and pink foamy sputum indicates acute left heart failure ( Also known as pulmonary edema); hemoptysis in bronchiectasis is bright red; hemoptysis in typical lobar pneumonia is rust-colored; thick dark red bloody sputum is coughed up during pulmonary embolism: while hemoptysis in mitral stenosis combined with pulmonary congestion is not bright red, but is generally Dark red clinical manifestations 1. Young adults - tuberculosis, bronchiectasis, rheumatic stenosis; over 40 years old with a long-term history of heavy smoking - chronic bronchitis, bronchial lung cancer (shown as persistent or intermittent blood in sputum) 2. Small amount of hemoptysis: The daily amount of hemoptysis is less than 100ml. Medium amount of hemoptysis: The daily amount of hemoptysis is 100~500ml. Large amount of hemoptysis: The daily amount of hemoptysis is more than 500ml, or 300~500ml of hemoptysis at one time. It is seen in tuberculosis cavities, bronchiectasis and chronic lung disease. Abscess (caused by erosion and rupture of blood vessels) 3. Signs: The lungs should be examined in detail. When chest X-ray examination is not available, percussion method can be used to identify the bleeding site as early as possible. For example, when hemoptysis begins, the breath sounds of one lung are weakened or/and rales appear, but the breath sounds of the contralateral lung field are good. It indicates that the bleeding is on that side. Physical examination can also support some specific diagnoses. For example, mitral diastolic murmur is helpful for the diagnosis of rheumatic heart disease; stridor in localized lung and bronchial areas often indicates intrabronchial lesions, such as lung cancer or foreign bodies. ; Vascular murmurs in the lung fields support arteriovenous malformations; finger clubbing is more common in lung cancer, bronchiectasis and lung abscess; supraclavicular and anterior scalene lymph nodes are enlarged, supporting metastatic cancer. Examination 1. Routine examination of hematuria and stool, examination of coagulation mechanism, acid-fast bacilli, tumor cells in sputum, lung aspiration, general sputum culture and fungal culture, etc., are very helpful in clarifying the cause of hemoptysis. 2. X-ray examination: Every patient with hemoptysis should undergo chest X-ray fluoroscopy, and if necessary, undergo posteroanterior and lateral chest photography, slice and CT photography. 3. Bronchoscopy. 4. Electrocardiogram.

Patient:
Hypothyroidism, hyperthyroidism in 1996, and later drug-induced hypothyroidism
Doctor:
Hypothyroidism, referred to as hypothyroidism, is a systemic hypometabolic syndrome caused by insufficient synthesis, secretion or biological effects of thyroid hormones caused by various reasons. Its pathological feature is the accumulation of mucopolysaccharides in tissues and skin, and severe cases manifest as myxedema. The treatment of hypothyroidism is troublesome and not easy to treat. Generally, supplementation of extracorporeal thyroid hormone is the main method. Euthyrox can be used to treat it.

What kind of medicine should I take to treat my child's constant hiccups? My 5-year-old child has been hiccupping recently. He burps occasionally. At first, he thought it was because he was too full, so he didn't care. Later, he found out that it was not because he was too full, but because he had injured his trachea. This condition has been going on for two weeks. What can I take to treat it?

Patient:
What are the clinical manifestations of polyhydramnios?
Doctor:
Symptoms usually only appear when the amniotic fluid volume exceeds 3000ml. (1) Acute polyhydramnios: It usually occurs between 20 and 24 weeks of pregnancy. Due to the sharp increase in amniotic fluid, the uterus enlarges rapidly within a few days, similar to the size of a full-term pregnancy or a twin pregnancy. In a short period of time, due to the extreme enlargement of the uterus, the transverse The diaphragm lifts up, causing difficulty in breathing, inability to lie down, and even cyanosis. The pregnant woman has a painful expression, excessive abdominal tension, pain, and reduced food intake, resulting in constipation. The enlarged uterus compresses the inferior vena cava, affecting venous return, causing edema and varicose veins in the lower limbs and vulva. Pregnant women have difficulty walking and can only lie on their sides. (2) Chronic polyhydramnios: accounts for about 98% and mostly occurs between 28 and 32 weeks of pregnancy. The amniotic fluid can gradually increase within a few weeks, which is a moderate and slow increase. Most pregnant women can adapt to it. It is often found during prenatal check-ups. The uterine height and abdominal circumference are both larger than those of pregnant women in the same period. During the physical examination, pregnant women with polyamniotic fluid will find that the abdominal distension is greater than the month of pregnancy. The pregnancy chart shows that the uterine height curve exceeds the normal number of digits. The skin on the abdominal wall is shiny and thin. When palpating, the skin tension is high, there is a tremor of fluid, and the fetal position It is not clear, and sometimes there is a floating feeling when touching the fetal part, and the fetal heartbeat is distant or cannot be heard. Pregnant women with polyhydramnios are prone to complications of pregnancy-induced hypertension, abnormal fetal position, and premature delivery. The sudden shrinkage of the uterus after rupture of membranes can cause placental abruption. When membranes rupture, the umbilical cord can slip out with the amniotic fluid, causing umbilical cord prolapse. Postpartum uterine enlargement can easily cause uterine contraction weakness and lead to postpartum hemorrhage.

Patient:
What is the cause of chest filariasis?
Doctor:
(1) Causes of the disease The final host of Filaria bancrofti and Filaria malayi is humans. Patients or carriers with microfilariae in their blood are the main source of infection for this disease. However, some people have also found these two kinds of filarial worms in the lymphatic systems of monkeys, dogs, pigs and some wild animals, so animal hosts of the parasite may also exist. The main mosquito species that transmit filariasis bancrofti are Culex pipiens and Culex quinquefasciatus, followed by Anopheles sinensis. The main mosquito species that transmit Malay filariasis are Anopheles sinensis and Anopheles reggae, and Aedes dongxiang in coastal areas can also transmit Bancroft and Malay filariasis. (2) Pathogenesis The pathogenesis of thoracic filariasis is mainly divided into two stages: early stage: mostly allergic reactions and inflammatory reactions mainly exudation, microfilariae and metabolites of adult worms, molting fluid and exfoliation, adult worm uterus Internal secretions, dead parasites and their decomposition products can cause systemic or local allergic reactions in the body, which can manifest as eosinophil infiltration in the lungs, asthma, dry cough, chest pain, bloody sputum, shortness of breath, etc. Respiratory symptoms; chronic stage: Due to the specificity of lymph circulation, the deep lymphatic system in the chest is blocked by eosinophilic granuloma or fibrosis, causing lymphatic reflux obstruction. The lymphatic vessels below the blockage expand, increase pressure or even rupture, so chylothorax occurs. , chylophlegm, etc.

Patient:
What are the symptoms of interstitial cystitis, vulvitis, and desquamative vaginitis syndrome?
Doctor:
Patients with interstitial cystitis, localized vulvitis and desquamative vaginitis syndrome have frequent urination, pyuria and bladder pain, nocturia, vulvar pruritus, vulvar discomfort, dyspareunia, pain during sexual intercourse, abnormal vaginal discharge, abnormalities Genital tract odor, vestibular lesions may be present, urethral tenderness and bladder tenderness. There are small erythematous lesions in the lateral vestibule of the hymen, and other examinations are normal. Pressing these lesions with cotton swabs or inspection fingers can cause tenderness or discomfort. Discomfort, burning, or pain in the vulva. All vaginas have purulent secretions, and the vaginal pH value is 4.5 to 5.5. Adding 10% potassium hydroxide solution to the secretions will not produce a fishy odor. Patients are more common in young women and have many sexual partners. Women who drink alcohol are prone to this syndrome. In addition, the above clinical manifestations should be considered for the existence of this syndrome. The diagnosis of interstitial cystitis can be made by cystoscopy under anesthesia. The initial appearance and capacity of the bladder are normal, but as the bladder fills, empties, and then refills, scattered submucosal bleeding is often seen. Biopsy can reveal the above-mentioned pathological changes of edema, congestion, telangiectasia and perivascular interstitial hemorrhage in the subepidermal layer, and can also be used to rule out some carcinoma in situ and tuberculosis lesions. In localized vulvitis, there is a small erythematous lesion in the lateral vestibule of the hymen, but the rest is normal. The vaginal pH value is measured, and 10% potassium hydroxide solution is added to the vaginal secretions. There is no fishy smell. No cells that can indicate diagnosis can be seen in the secretion suspension under a microscope, but there are only a large number of white blood cells and immature vaginal secretions in the secretions. Epithelial cells (basal-like cells), culture for Chlamydia trachomatis, gonococcus and Trichomonas vaginalis were all negative.

Infertile. Women's uterine dysplasia, such as immature uterus, premature ovarian failure, amenorrhea, irregular menstruation, loss of sexual desire, infertility, etc. Symptoms of kidney deficiency include: frequent urination, waiting to urinate, long and clear urine, etc. 3. Symptoms of kidney deficiency may also include: premature aging, forgetfulness and insomnia, loss of appetite, bone and joint pain, weakness in the waist and knees, fatigue intolerance, weakness, vision loss, and hearing loss. Hair loss, gray hair, hair loss or premature graying of beards, loose and easy teeth, etc. Premature aging of the face, eye bags, dark circles, dull complexion, rough and dry skin, wrinkles, spots, middle-aged acne, lack of elasticity of the skin; gradually hoarse voice, female breasts begin to sag, waist and abdominal fat accumulation, male early Bald et al.

Patient:
What causes epididymitis in children?
Doctor:
Testicles are an important part of the male body. If men do not pay attention to conditioning in their daily lives, they are likely to suffer from orchitis. Symptoms of orchitis often include frequent urination and painful urination. This Sometimes patients need to go to the hospital for treatment in time, which can relieve the pain of orchitis patients in time. So what should you do if you suffer from orchitis? Orchitis is usually caused by bacteria and viruses. Therefore, you must pay attention to hygiene, bathe frequently, and wear regular clothes. Bacterial infections rarely occur in the testicles themselves. Don't put too much pressure on yourself, keep a relaxed attitude and don't be overly nervous. As long as you persist in treatment, you will be cured. Men need to pay attention to the development of eating habits in a timely manner. Do not eat spicy and fried foods frequently. Do not smoke or drink excessively. Eat more vegetables and fruits to ensure the vitamins and nutrients needed by the body. Be careful not to stay in bed too often. In public places where there is smoke. When men suffer from orchitis, they should pay attention to personal hygiene, keep the body clean and massage in time. Regular massage can also promote the reduction of inflammation, reduce excessive masturbation, reduce sexual life, and pay attention to changing underwear frequently. , to avoid the growth of bacteria. Patients should also not stay up late all the time, pay attention to ensure enough sleep time, avoid too much pressure, decompress in time, not be too nervous, maintain a happy mood and actively cooperate with treatment, and conduct self-examination in a timely manner, etc. wait. Note: Patients suffering from epididymitis need to quit smoking and drinking in time. Smoking and alcohol will cause great harm to the disease, especially the recurrence of the disease. If epididymitis is not effectively cured for a long time, it will cause many problems. Serious male reproductive problems can also cause infertility. Patients should exercise regularly during treatment. Timely exercise can effectively prevent some diseases in the body. If you develop orchitis, the editor recommends that you go to the hospital for treatment immediately, and this disease is very harmful to the human body. Yes, severe disease affects people's normal sexual life. During this period, patients are advised to quit masturbation and pay more attention to physical exercise.

Patient:
Diet taboos for pregnant women with high blood sugar
Doctor:
Nutritional status will directly affect the development and growth of your baby. Therefore, new mothers must first pay enough attention to postpartum nutrition and cannot think that "you can lose weight immediately after the baby is born!" At the same time, new mothers should pay attention to some eating habits that have more harm than good. 1. Avoid eating too much MSG. In order to avoid zinc deficiency in babies, new mothers should avoid eating too much MSG. Generally speaking, it is beneficial and harmless for adults to eat MSG, but for babies, especially those under 12 weeks, it is not good if the breastfeeding mother consumes an excessive amount of MSG while taking a high-protein diet. Because the sodium glutamate in MSG will enter the baby's body through milk. Excessive sodium glutamate has a serious impact on the development of babies, especially babies under 12 weeks old. It can specifically combine with zinc in the baby's blood to generate glutamate that cannot be absorbed by the body, while zinc is lost in the urine. Excreted, resulting in zinc deficiency in infants. In this way, infants are not only prone to poor taste and anorexia, but can also cause mental retardation, growth and development retardation and other adverse consequences. 2. Avoid eating too many eggs. Medical research shows that it is best not to eat eggs within a few hours after delivery. Because during the delivery process, the new mother exerts a lot of physical energy, sweats a lot, lacks body fluids, and her digestion ability also decreases. If eggs are eaten immediately after delivery, it will be difficult to digest. 3. Avoid eating too much brown sugar. Brown sugar is rich in nutrients, releases energy quickly, has high nutrient absorption and utilization rate, and has warming and tonic properties. After giving birth, new mothers lose some blood and become weak. They need to quickly replenish iron, calcium, manganese, zinc and other trace elements and proteins in large quantities. Avoid eating greasy foods. Since postpartum new mothers have weak gastrointestinal distension and peristalsis, overly greasy foods such as fatty meats, suet, peanuts, etc. should be eaten as little as possible to avoid indigestion. By the same token, fried foods are more difficult to digest and new mothers should not eat too much. Moreover, a lot of nutrients in fried foods have been lost during the frying process, and are worse in nutrients than pasta and other foods. Eating more will not increase nutrition for new mothers, but will increase the burden on the gastrointestinal tract. Avoid eating spicy, hot and spicy foods. After delivery, new mothers lose a lot of blood and sweat, and more interstitial fluid enters the blood circulation. Therefore, the body's Yin and body fluids are obviously insufficient. Spicy, hot and hot foods will damage body fluids and consume fluids, making the new mother suffer from internal heat. Mouth and tongue sores, constipation or hemorrhoids occur, and the baby's internal heat will be aggravated through milk. Therefore, new mothers should not eat leeks, onions, garlic, chilies, peppers, cumin, wine, etc.

Patient:
Does intrauterine adhesions affect the fetus?
Doctor:
Intrauterine adhesions can also occur in other non-pregnancy periods, such as after diagnosis and curettage, after diagnosis and curettage, after myomectomy, cervical biopsy or polypectomy, after laser irradiation, and after hysteroscopy. For example, after mediastinal resection, submucosal myomectomy, bilateral uterine artery embolization, and postpartum hemorrhage after uterine artery ligation, infection is commonly caused by endometrial tuberculosis. Chronic or subacute endometritis may also lead to intrauterine adhesions. , Others, related to abnormal development of Mullerian ducts, especially septate uterus, genetic factors, this disease is related to genetic factors. Most of the symptoms of intrauterine adhesions have no typical symptoms. They are mainly changes in menstruation, less menstrual flow, or even amenorrhea, dysmenorrhea and other symptoms. Some people also find it during medical examination due to infertility or repeated miscarriage. Intrauterine adhesions are divided into categories according to the degree of adhesion. Fifth degree, first degree, there are many fibrous adhesions in the uterine cavity, and the uterine horns and fallopian tube openings on both sides are normal. Second degree, there are dense fibrous bundle adhesions between the front and back walls of the uterus, and the uterine horns and fallopian tube openings are visible on both sides. Third degree , fibrous fascicular adhesion causes partial uterine cavity and one uterine horn atresia, fourth degree, fibrous fascicular adhesion causes partial uterine cavity and both uterine horn atresia, fifth degree, adhesion band scarring causes extreme deformation and stenosis of the uterine cavity. You need to consult a professional hospital according to your own situation. If intrauterine adhesions appear, the volume of the uterus will be reduced, which will affect the normal implantation of the embryo and affect the survival of the fetus in the uterine cavity to term. If it is serious, you can go to a higher-level hospital for minimally invasive surgery. , if the problem is not serious, you can do a pregnancy checkup and recheck regularly. Uterine adhesions are closely related to uterine infection. As the pregnancy period increases, uterine adhesions affect the space needed for the growth of the fetus, which has a certain impact on the fetus. It is easy to cause miscarriage. B-ultrasounds should be observed regularly. If you feel abnormal fetal movement, go to the hospital for examination immediately. You must pay special attention to every change in your body. Once abnormal problems occur, you must actively seek treatment.

Patient:
What to do if laryngeal ulcer occurs in advanced stage of laryngeal cancer
Doctor:
For late-stage laryngeal cancer, conservative treatment can control the disease and biological therapy can be selected. Biological treatment can greatly improve the quality of life while ensuring significant therapeutic effects. You will have obvious feelings, such as pain relief, good appetite, good mental state, etc. Laryngeal cancer is divided into two types: primary and secondary. Primary laryngeal cancer refers to tumors whose primary site is in the larynx, with squamous cell carcinoma being the most common. Secondary laryngeal cancer refers to the metastasis of malignant tumors from other parts to the larynx, which is relatively rare. The main symptoms of laryngeal cancer are hoarseness, difficulty breathing, coughing, difficulty swallowing, and cervical lymph node metastasis. High-risk groups should pay attention to quit smoking, drink appropriately, and take preventive measures. Early detection and early diagnosis and treatment are very important to reduce the harm of laryngeal cancer. On the one hand, it can improve the patient's postoperative survival rate. On the other hand, it is possible to preserve the pronunciation function of the larynx and reduce postoperative complications. There is currently no exact cause of laryngeal cancer. It may be caused by a combination of factors. Smoking is closely related to respiratory tract tumors. Most patients with laryngeal cancer have a long-term history of heavy smoking. The incidence of laryngeal cancer is directly proportional to the daily amount of cigarettes smoked and the total smoking time. In addition, passive smoking cannot be ignored, as it may also cause cancer. The risk of laryngeal cancer among drinkers is 1.5 to 4.4 times higher than that among non-drinkers. In particular, supraglottic laryngeal cancer is closely related to drinking. Smoking and drinking have a synergistic effect in causing cancer. Physical examination of the neck includes inspection and palpation of the laryngeal shape and cervical lymph nodes. Observe whether the larynx body is enlarged. For palpation of cervical lymph nodes, check gradually from top to bottom, front to back according to the distribution pattern of cervical lymph nodes to clarify the location and size of swollen lymph nodes. Current treatments for laryngeal cancer include surgery, radiotherapy, chemotherapy and biological therapy. Sometimes a combination of treatments can improve the 5-year survival rate of laryngeal cancer, preserve the vocal function of the patient's larynx to the greatest extent, and improve the patient's health. Quality of Life. In histoembryology, the left and right sides of the larynx develop independently, and the supraglottis, glottis, and subglottis come from different primordia; the left and right lymphatic drainage are not connected to each other, and the supraglottic, glottis, and subglottic lymphatic drainage Each is independent and provides a basis for surgical treatment of the larynx, especially partial resection. Depending on the location of the cancer, different surgical techniques can be used. The best way to treat unbearable pain in the late stage of throat cancer is to take painkillers, but there are side effects, so it is better to take less. Eat less spicy, fried and salty food to keep the patient in a good mood.

Patient:
How much does a neurosyphilis test cost?
Doctor:
The symptoms of neurosyphilis are not specific and can be manifested as asymptomatic neurosyphilis, in which abnormalities are only found during cerebrospinal fluid testing, but there are no neurological symptoms or signs. Meningeal syphilis often needs to be distinguished from aseptic meningitis. The symptoms are very similar, such as headache, fever, photophobia, rigidity, etc. Some patients even experience loss of sensation, muscle atrophy, neck pain, and weakened tendon reflexes. In severe cases, paraplegia may occur. Patients with meningovascular syphilis may have symptoms such as dizziness, insomnia, memory loss, and even mental and emotional changes. There are many symptoms of neurosyphilis. A cerebrospinal fluid puncture is required to confirm the diagnosis. Testing for syphilis antibodies in the cerebrospinal fluid can make a clear diagnosis. A general tertiary hospital costs about 1,000 to 5,000 yuan to check for neurosyphilis. Neurosyphilis tests are usually confirmed through serological tests. When a person has high-risk sexual behavior or is suspected of being infected with syphilis, experts recommend going to the hospital for a serological test in time. , but after syphilis infection, it is not possible to find out after a subsequent examination. Usually there is a window period after syphilis infection. When a person is infected with syphilis, Treponema pallidum reproduces in the body, but the amount of reproduction is very small, and ordinary serological tests may not detect it. This period is about 40-40 years after infection. 90 days later, the patient's serology test was negative, but Treponema pallidum was already present in the body. Treatment of neurosyphilis should be carried out early and with sufficient medication. During the treatment period, the spouse should also undergo examinations, receive treatment if necessary, and undergo regular reexaminations after recovery. Patients with early syphilis are required to refrain from sexual intercourse. Those who have been ill for more than two years should also try to avoid sexual intercourse and must use condoms during sexual contact. It is not advisable to become pregnant during the illness. If the patient becomes pregnant, treatment should begin as soon as possible. Strict prenatal serologic testing for syphilis. If syphilis is found, anti-syphilis treatment should be given regardless of whether the patient has received anti-syphilis treatment in the past. Strict prenatal check-up. If uterine contractions are obvious or fetal movement decreases, you should see an obstetrician at any time.

Patient:
My husband has asthma. Over the past 2 weeks he has had a chronic cough, difficulty breathing and abdominal bloating. His inhaler is not helping. What are some things we can do at home to relieve the symptoms? What could it be? Should he go to the doctor?
Doctor:
Hi, thank you for providing the brief history of your husband. A detailed examination of the chest and abdomen is advised. As he is suffering from Asthma, along with the inhaler, is her performing any breathing exercises. As in asthma, due to the pathology of the lung tissue the respiratory muscles become weak. So even after providing inhalation the symptoms of breathlessness don't subside and produce cough back to back. I will advise to do stem inhalation and also breathing exercises. Steam inhalation will help loosen the secretion of the lungs and breathing exercises will help improve the lung capacity and strengthen the muscles of respiration. Also, taking a help from a physical therapist will not be bad as they can help understand how to perform the breathing exercises. The breathing exercises include -* deep breathing exercises* abdominal breathing exercises* diaphragmatic breathing exercises* costal breathing exercises* pursed lip breathing exercises* huffing & coughing technique.in my clinical practice I see cases with breathing disorders. And by teaching them how to perform breathing exercises have helped them practice in home and optimum results are achieved. Also, a physical therapist will help you core Strengthening exercises, as core is the muscle of respiration and needs to be stronger. With all forms of breathing exercises there will be improvement in the lung capacities and ease in breathing. You can discuss the same with your pulmonologist. RegardsJay In Chat Doctor.

Doctor:
Hi, Nikoran and Arbitrate can cause headaches, and you can stop it. Use tab Arbitrate sublingual whenever needed. Your symptoms are suggestive heart disease, so you should get your test done. Avoid salty diet, monitor your blood pressure. Is it controlled on current medicine or not? You need to have healthy lifestyle and also need to add some medicine like atorvastatin. Patient:
my daughter has for years complained of a knot on her left lower abdomen. She is very uncomfortable at all times. Tests were done and all negative. MRI, cat scan , esophagoscopy , ultrasound, colonoscopy. What treatment do you recommend next. Would you recommend an exploratory surgery?
Doctor:
Hi. The reason of a knot on lower abdomen with all the investigations can be a hernia only, or an intermittent spam of the local muscles being felt and painful sometimes and not at other times. More than the investigations Clinical/ Physical Examination is the most important. So consult a General Surgeon who is well-trained to find the rare cause of such symptoms which are not picked by any investigations. Colorectal Cancer could have been detected on all the investigations like CT scan and MRI already done. Colonoscopy to rule out such problems is highly recommended. MRI-Magnetic Resonance Imaging helps in the stationary organs and not in the moving organs like intestines.

Patient:

Doctor:
It's possible that you have seborrheic keratosis, which is a harmless skin condition commonly seen in older adults. To confirm the diagnosis, I recommend a complete physical skin exam performed by a dermatologist. Depending on the size and location of the growths, you may need an excision, excision of skin lesion, or biopsy. We may also need to do other diagnostic procedures on skin and subcutaneous tissue, or other therapeutic procedures, such as wound care management.

Patient:
I have been experiencing abdominal pain in the middle of the abdomen for about 3 weeks now on and off, it worsens when I eat certain foods, lessens when I eat saltine crackers. Its a burning sharp pain followed by chills throughout my body with severe headaches as well. It comes on goes and I never know when I will feel it again. My lower back pain is also associated in this. The episodes will last somewhere between 10 minutes to hours. Can you tell me whats going on?
Doctor:
Hello, thanks for using Chat Doctor It would appear you are suffering from a peptic ulcer disease. Peptic ulcer disease generally is caused by a bacterium called H. pylori which causes inflammation of the gastric mucosa resulting in peptic ulcer diseases. Certain food particularly worsens peptic ulcer symptoms. The pain produced radiates posteriorly to the back with a typical burning and cramps pains that might be associated with headaches and dizziness given you the characteristic picture of what you are experiencing. Peptic ulcer disease is usually treated by -first of all eradicating the bacteria by combination of Chat Doctor.

You're all symptoms like chest tightness, racing heart rate, swelling in legs, breathing difficulty in lying down position etc. are suggestive of heart failure. Patient:
My wife, age 66, has most of the signs of early alzheimers. However, one is very troubling to me: she makes up stories that those around her are trying to hurt her and are a danger to her. She really thinks that these events are true. I dont know how to handle this.
Doctor:
Hi, I can understand your concern regarding your wives symptoms. Dementia is a condition where a person cognitive functions like memory, attention, judgement, etc. starts getting impaired. Dementia can be due to multiple causes including Alzheimer's disease. In addition to memory, a person suffering from dementia can have symptoms of hallucinations and delusions as well. In fact, in some types of dementia, such symptoms may predominate the picture. You wife suspecting that people are trying to harm her is suggestive of her developing paranoid delusions. I would suggest you seek a neurological consultation for evaluation of the cause of dementia. In addition, a psychiatric consultation can be sought for evaluation of behavioral symptoms. She would need a brain scan to rule out any other cause of dementia. Treatment with medications like donepezil or meantime would be required for her memory symptoms. In addition, treatment with anti-psychotic Chat Doctor.  Hope this information was helpful. Best wishes.

Patient:

I will list them now. -Heart Palpitations all day -Numbness in Arms every morning -Occasional, BAD Vertigo episodes (2-4 times a week) -Flash of light in just my right eye -Painful zit like sores on both legs inner thigh -Weakness of Grip in both hands -Pain in my left wrist and I occasionally cant push my thumb and index fingers together without it hurting a lot (this happens sometimes) I went to the doctor and wore a holter monitor and was told it was benign pvcs and it might be anxiety...but I felt something more serious was wrong. I got a 2nd opinion and got blood work done, and was told I tested postive and negatove for lyme disease. The test that determines if I have it now was negative, and the test that determines if ive ever had it was positive. I had never been diagnosed with lyme...so I may have had it for a while...not sure. Anyway, I took antiobiotics for a month and after 3 weeks on them my palpitations disappeared along with the weird zits on my thighs. I felt a little better and had joint pain still ..but not having the palpitations was a relief. I finished my dosage and about 3 weeks after I stopped...my palpitations came right back full force and the painful small boil/zits came back. I feel like all of these symptoms are related to one another...I dont know what I could have. Please, if theres anybody who can ask me a series of questions to help solve my lifes mystery id be forever grateful. Has anyone had identical symptoms? Or have any doctors on here dealt with similar cases? Im truly desperate. I appreciate you taking the time out of your life to read this. Thank you!
Doctor:
Hello! Thank you for asking on Chat Doctor! I understand your concern and would like to explain that Lyme disease is a chronic disease, which can affect many systems of organs, including the heart, muscles, skin, central and peripheral nervous system etc.. Based on your symptomatology, the fact that you symptoms disappeared while on antibiotic therapy and reappeared, means that this is a chronic infection. Have you been tested for both antigens and antibodies of Lyme disease or only just antibodies? Sometimes the antigens can persist in the blood for years, indicating a chronic infection, even though the antibodies don't show this. I would recommend consulting with an infectious disease specialist for further tests for Lyme disease. An ambulatory 24-48 hour monitoring is necessary to examine your heart rhythm, for possible cardiac arrhythmia. If you were my patient, I would continue the treatment with antibiotics, as it seems that this resistant bacteria is still causing disturbances on your body organ function. Hope to have been helpful! Best wishes, 

Patient:
i seem to have large bumbs on the back of my tongur like enlarged taste buds i searched the net and it could be enlarged circumvallate papillae. the reason why it causing me problem is becuase everything tastes bitter to me things like sodas and even water
Doctor:
Thanks for using Chat Doctor. Read your query. Enlarged circumvallate papillae usually occurs due to few factors including hot and spicy food, gastroesophageal reflux and some infection, excessive smoking and canker sores. You should not worry as it is a not a condition which is dangerous. Maintain a good oral hygiene, reduce hot and spicy food. If you smoke excessively reduce smoking. Use saline water gargling. Usually it will subside on its own. If still worried consult an oral surgeon and have it checked. Hope this was helpful. Thanks and regards.

If one of your parents have Schizophrenia, then the risk of you getting Schizophrenia is about 10%. You have mentioned that you are having some symptoms of Schizophrenia, but you have not given any details. Patient:
Dear doctor, am the sixth child for my parents..my 3rd sister and myself has yellow teeth..yellow teeth means not slightly yellow..thick dark yellow..when i asked to my parents they told when the teeth started to grow as an infant itself started to grow as yellow for my sister and for me it was in white in color only but well the milk teeth fell and permanent teeth started to grow at that time it started to grow as yellow (pure yellow in color) now am 36 years of age..when i asked doctors some of them told it was calcium deficiency..now already it is too late..is there any way to rectify doctor
Doctor:
Helloi have gone through your query.discoloration of teeth can be due to various reasons.in your case the antibiotics tetracycline and doxycycline are known to discolor teeth when given to child Chat Doctor.  Mouth rinses and washes containing chlorhexidine and cetylpyridinium chloride can also stain teeth. As you age, the outer layer of enamel on your teeth gets worn away revealing the natural yellow color of dentin. Excessive fluoride either from environmental sources (naturally high fluoride levels in water) can also discolor the teeth. Poor oral hygiene can also lead to yellowness of teeth. But you don't have to worry. You can go for certain procedures to fix this problem:Thorough scaling (cleaning) of your teeth. Avoidance of the foods and beverages that cause stainsVeneersUsing over-the-counter whitening agentsIn-home whitening agents purchased from your dentistIn-office whitening procedures Hope this ans helpsRegards

Patient:
i have been having stomach problems for years. after looking online, i noticed i have all the symptoms of gallbladder problems. it hurts everytime i eat anything with fat in it, and i have lost about 30 pounds in a few months. i have no health insurance and i am starting to get worried. should i go to the ER?
Doctor:
Hi.thank you for posting query at Chat Doctor. Further evaluation advised. Ultrasonography is recommended to rule out gall stones. Gallstones are small stones that form inside the gallbladder. Gallstones pain (Biliary colic) usually is experienced when the gallbladder contracts in response to a fatty meal. This compresses the stones, blocking the opening. As the gallbladder relaxes several hours after the meal, the pain subsides. Medical therapy is an option for gallstones, though a vast number of surgeons around the globe prefer removal of gall bladder-surgical intervention. Medical therapy includes intake of ursodeoxyholic acid (UCA) for a period of 12 to 24 months. UCA has been shown to inhibit biliary secretion of cholesterol, reduce intestinal absorption of cholesterol, increase hepatic bile secretion, and improve gallbladder emptying. Medical therapy is useful if mild symptoms, stones are smaller (weight reduction and low-fat diet is also a part of medical therapy. Hope to answer your concern. Wish you good and sound health. Regards Chat Doctor.

PFT is must for the diagnosis of bronchitis. You may need antibiotics, inhaled bronchodilators (formoterol or albuterol) and inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) (budesonide or fluticasone).Don't worry, you will be alright with all these. Patient:
My mom was diagnosed 2 years ago with colon cancer.  she had radiation and chemo and surgery and was told there would be no more cancer after all that.  she then found out last march that it has spread to her liver and lungs....they suspect it spread before she even knew she had the cancer in her colon.  she did not want any more chemo....she is 80 years old, has a very very small appetite now, pain and is sleepy allot....how long can this go on?
Doctor:
Hi, Thanks for writing in. Unfortunately multiple liver lesions cannot be treated completely. Colon cancer causes liver metastasis in half of the patients even after surgery. CEA test is to be done regularly to know the progressive increase and possibility of a recurrence of the tumor and spread to liver. Colon cancer might cause liver spread and this also has to be looked for by doing an ultrasound scan and CT scan if required. Since you know that the condition has become palliative, there is a possibility to extend his survival by giving chemotherapy which will reduce new blood vessel formation and also inhibit growth. With the best treatment and supportive care she might survive for about one to two years. It is important to discuss with your doctor if she can take chemotherapy. Radiofrequency ablation is another procedure for colon cancer patients with liver metastasis, but it is not for all patients and requires certain criteria to be adhered to for response to treatment. Please do not worry.

Patient:

At first it looked like perhaps a bug bite but since they appear at all times and are spreading that doenst seem likely.
Doctor:
Hello. Thanks for writing to us at Chat Doctor Extremely itchy rash/bumps involving the trunk, arms and legs can be due to scabies. In scabies the lesions resemble insect bites and are distributed over the torso, arms and legs; specially inner thighs, maxilla and chest, finger webs etc. Family history of similar lesions and itching can be a significant clue towards scabies. If I was the treating doctor I would like to treat her empirically for scabies with Single whole body application of 5% Permethrin lotion, kept overnight for 8 hours, followed by scrub bath next day. An OTC oral antihistamine e, g cetirizine 10 mg once daily would provide symptomatic relief from itching. Regards

Patient:
hello, i think i have a swollen lymph node but its been there for over a year now. It started when my boyfriend gave me a hickey back in march 2010. I thought it would go away but it hasn t. However, it sometimes shrinks (but i could still feel it under my skin) and on other day it goes back to its swollen size .
Doctor:
Dear I can understand your concern. I would like to inform you that lymph nodes are the site for killing of infectious agents. So if there is any infection they need to work more and more and in response they get enlarged. As the infection subsides lymph nodes also decrease in size. They have a normal size and may be palpable normally also. This size vary for different groups of nodes. For example size of 1 cm is normal for lymph nodes around neck and size of up to 2 cm is normal for inguinal lymph nodes. They are also increased if there is any lymph node malignancies etc. In my opinion if you think it abnormal and is increasing in size or painful then you should consult to your physician for expert opinion. Hope this will help you.  If you have any other concerns please feel free to message me.  Thanks for contacting Chat Doctor.

Doctor:
Hello dear, I understand your concern. The BP is said to be high when it is equal to more than 140/90 mm Hg. If high BP is associated with protein in urine and edema feet then it is called preeclampsia. It might be due to cause at blood vessels level.Don't worry as there are medicines available which control the BP. If the BP is not getting controlled with medicine and is persistently high then labor is artificially induced for delivery. If the BP is controlled and the fetal movements are good you can wait up to EDD. So relax and avoid stress. Best regards...

Patient:
hi,i am 21 weeks pregnant but initially my doctors informed my placenta is low lying.it was around 1.1am anterior.but after my 20+6days Anomaly scan now my placental position is anterior high with the lower edge being 4cm away from the internal os.is it normal now?
Doctor:
Hello dear, I understand your concern. In my opinion your placental position is normal in position. Usual position of placenta is in the upper segment of uterus i.e., high. Presence of low-lying placenta in early pregnancy is a normal finding seen in a few women. As the pregnancy progresses the placenta position gradually moves up. If the placenta doesn't move up and remain in low position it is called low-lying placenta or placenta Pravda. When there is low-lying placenta there might be bleeding during the pregnancy leading to fetal distress. As your placenta has come to normal position you need not worry. Hope this helps. Best regards....

Patient:

Doctor:
Hi and welcome to Chat Doctor. Thank you for your query. I am Chat Doctor, I understand your concerns and I will try to help you as much as I can. High SGPT is indicator of liver damage or injury from different types of diseases or conditions, and collectively they are termed liver tests or liver blood tests. So the next step is to look for certain liver damage and most common cause is fatty liver disease. It should be confirmed by ultrasound. Other causes are viral hepatitis, cirrhosis, medications, alcohol intake or autoimmune diseases. To verify exact cause, US, bilirubin levels and tumor markers should be additional done. Then appropriate treatment can be started. I hope I have answered you query. If you have any further questions you can contact us in every time. Kindly regards. Wish you a good health.

Well, it was and I ended up with an infection so severe I had to have my sigmoid removed and had I not I would only have lived three to five months. That was in Nov. Now I have lymphoma and kidney cancer and I only have one kidney. What do I do now?

For Renal carcinoma for post-operative patients again one may be kept of observation alone to chemotherapy or immunotherapy options. Take care

Patient:
Hi. my father is at the age of 65, gone through a surgery of cist in  lower right jaw. Now he is having the problem of temporary loss of memory. A month back this simptom continued about 10 minutes. Otherwise he is healthy,takes good food, bp & sugar is nil. Can we get solutions from Neurologist ? we are from Koppa near Sringeri.
Doctor:
Hi, Thank you for posting your query. I have noted your fathers symptoms. They are suggestive of minor brain stroke-TIA (transient ischemic attack). In TIA, the blood supply to brain gets reduced for a short period of time, resulting in neurological symptoms. He should be seen by a neurologist and an MRI of brain should be done. He should also be started on aspirin tablets to prevent major brain strokes in the future. I hope my answer helps. Please get back if you have any follow-up queries or if you require any additional information. Wishing you good health, Chat Doctor. Ly/

Patient:
Good day. I m 34 years old and have found a lump as small as a bead at the tail (bottom)of the epididymis. Not painless and is separate from the testacle. It feels like if it is attached by a very short vein to the edidimytis on my left testes. What can this be. Do I need to be worried and can it be dangerous. I have made an appointment with the urologist however he can only see me on 23 February 2017.
Doctor:
Dear user, Thanks for your question. There may be a few possibilities1 Epididymis cyst. These are the small cysts (fluid-filled sacs) that can appear in the epididymis, usually cause no discomfort or pain. Usually, the doctor can diagnose it clinically, but sometimes an ultrasound may be needed to confirm the cyst. They are left alone if not infected, very big (which need needle aspiration of fluid in it), or painful. Rarely they may need removal by operation if causing suspicion or trouble.2 Spermatocyte: this is a cyst which feels like an epididymis cyst, but it is filled with sperm (semen). Again managed conservatively most of the time.3 Varicocele: this is like varicose veins of the small veins next to one testicle (testis) or both testes. It is usually described as feeling as a wriggling bag of worms. This is managed with surgery mostly, after preliminary investigations to see what's causing pressure on the testicular veins. 4 Lipoma: this is a fatty lump which can sometimes cause difficulty because it can be felt separate from the testis, just like an epididymis cyst. So I suggest if it is soft and doesn't increase in size, you can wait for the appointment. Just keep an eye on it. Do write back if there are any more concerns. Thanks

Patient:

Doctor:
Thanks for your query at Chat Doctor! It is caused by filariasis which is a parasitic disease that is caused by thread-like roundworms that are spread by blood-feeding black flies and mosquitoes. It is caused by Wuchereria Bancroft, Borgia Malay, and Borgia Timor. Supportive care must include prevention of secondary infection. Wash the affected area frequently, apply antiseptic creams to abrasions, keep their nails clean, wear comfortable footwear, and exercise the affected limb to aid lymphatic flow. Take bed rest, limb elevation, and compression bandages and analgesic. She needs prescriptions Chat Doctor.  Visit a local surgeon and get evaluated. Take care!

Patient:
i m an HBsAg positive person for the past 5 years. being a chronic hep b case i also took interferons for a year alongwith lamuvidin tablet. initially the viral load went below 20iu/ml but later it again went upto 1600iu/ml while i was going on with lamuvidin. since then i started entecavir which is for the last 1 & a half year. viral load for last one year has been lowest that is not detected. however i continue to be HBsAg positive. HBeAg has always been negative in my case. Am i ever going to b perfectly fine. But yes i m asymtomatic.
Doctor:
Hello, Individuals who remain Bag positive for at least six months are considered to be hepatitis B carriers. Carriers who have reconverted to Head negative status, in particular those who acquired the infection as adults, have very little viral multiplication and hence may be at little risk of long-term complications or of transmitting infection to others.However, you should keep on monitoring your ALT levels and if they are ever found above 60,then you would require the treatment with interferons and immune modulators. Thanks

Patient:
Hi yes in 51 years old and all of a sudden both my feet are swollen.not discolored or any pain.I smoke,should nt be diabetic my blood always been good when checked.My father used to get bouts of Gout but thats painfull is nt it?Im about 15 lbs overweight though.
Doctor:
Hi, thank you for providing the brief history of you. As mentioned your age is 51, feet swollen and gout. So Gouty arthritis are possibly responsible for the swelling of the feet. As in gout there is increase in the uric acid levels and that can be checked by a laboratory test. Taking medicine to reduce the uric acid levels is important to help reduce the swelling. Also, due to the pain in the feet, there is restriction of the mobility, may not be visually seen, but it happens such. So performing regular exercises for the lower limb will help improve the venous return and also core stability to stabilize the spine. With these there will be increase in the urine output and elimination of the uric acid. Also, currently you can use how water fermentation and elevate the leg above the level of the heart to reduce the swelling, but it will be a symptomatic help. For long term relief, performing exercises for the lower limbs and also the feet exercises which will be guided by a physical therapist can help to maintain the long term relief. I have seen many gouty arthritis patients, and with a combination of medication and physical therapy I have found 99% success rate in my patients. I wish the same for you. RegardsJay In Chat Doctor.

Patient:
Several months ago I would get a pain in my right leg and maybe a day after brusies would show up, this went on for about 3 months.  The leg pain stopped for maybe a month and now my right are was paining me and I have 2 litte red bruises.  What could be wrong?
Doctor:
Dear patient thank you for your question. Here are a few causes of spontaneous bruising and some tips to help you figure out what you might have1) Blood disorder:a. On Willy Brandt disease/ Hemophilia: A blood disorder due to lack of coagulation factors. It results in spontaneous bruising and is easy to rule by a simple blood test called COAGULATION PROFILE.b. Thrombocytopenia: Low platelet count can result in such symptoms. A coagulation profile will help to diagnose this condition as well. Leukemia: My intention is not to scare u but practically speaking it is a possibility especially if u feel fatigued and have bone pain or headaches. Please get a complete blood profile done2) Liver disorders of your coagulation factors come from your Liver hence a Liver disorder mostly cirrhosis can result in such symptoms. Get an LFT done. Yellowing of your eyes/jaundice may hint at a Liver disease however it is not a rule3) Vitamin deficiency: Vitamin C and b12 deficiency can result in bruising as well. The test is time-consuming and expensive so just take a multivitamin tablet every day and see how u feel after 2 weeks4)Graces disease: This is a thyroid disorder and may be accompanied by excessive sweating feeling hot increase appetite yet wt loss. A thyroid profile is warranted. More common in females5) Excessive medication/ Injury: If you are taking any medication please read the label to see if hematoma or bruising is a mentioned side effect.Also, if you go to the gym or run a lot this can happen strongly urge you to discuss this with your go and reach a diagnosis. In the meantime for your pain here is what you can do1) Ibuprofen 800 mg twice a day2) Cold compression over the bruising3) Elevation of the leg while sitting down Hope this helped.

Patient:
Doctor, I have been experiencing swelling in my neck and difficulty in swallowing. I am worried it could be goiter.
Doctor:
Based on your symptoms, we need to conduct a few tests to confirm if it is goiter. We need to perform a hematology test, an ultrasound, a lipid panel, a complete physical skin exam, and a biopsy. Once we have the results of the tests, we can confirm the diagnosis. In some cases, we may also recommend an excision to remove the goiter depending on the severity of the condition. Additionally, we'll need to perform a hemoglobin A1c measurement test to ensure you don't have diabetes which can exacerbate this condition.

Patient:
Hi, may I answer your health queries right now ?  Please type your query here...Yes..Hi..I am on cardizem..due to a reaction to green tea pills a few years ago..i am a type A personality..I have been taking percocet regularly for at least 3 years for my back..yesterday i took my BP..and it was 175/105..I have EXTREME WHITE Coat syndrome..even when i walk by the bp machine at wal-mart i get a dry mouth..i wasnt having a headache or any other problems..i just took my bp..and now im going crazy..obviously..Thank you for your time
Doctor:
Hello! Welcome on Chat Doctor! I passed carefully through your question and would explain that a single high blood pressure values does not indicate uncontrolled high blood pressure. I recommend you to closely monitor your blood pressure values for a week, several times during the day (in sitting position after 10 minutes of total relax) and refer those values to your doctor. If your blood pressure values are above the normal ranges (140/90 mm Hg) most of the time, you should discuss with your doctor on the possibility of starting antihypertensive therapy. In such case some other tests would be necessary to exclude other secondary causes of high blood pressure: - a chest X-ray study-thyroid hormone levels-complete blood count for anemia-blood electrolytes for electrolyte imbalance-kidney and liver function tests-fasting glucose. Anyway, if your blood pressure values are elevated only during anxiety or physical stress, I would not recommend any treatment. Hope to have been helpful! Wishing all the best,
